sense.definition: Daleth, the fourth letter of the Alphabet; it interchanges dialectically with ז, e.g. זב, דב; with צ, e.g. אֶדְבַּע, אֶצְבַּע.
sense.notes: —ד eliminated in אוּנָּא = אוּדְנָא, קַמָּא = קַדְמָא.

sense.definition: as a numeral, four, v. א'.
a prefix, corresp. to h. שֶׁ־, of, who, which, that (quod).
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXXI, 42. Ib. IX, 5; a. v. fr.—Ber. 2 a זמן ק"ש דשכיבה the time of reading the Sh’ma of bed-time (Deut. VI, 7). Ib. ליתני דערבית וכ' let him first state that of (the law concerning) the evening prayer. Ib. הא קמ"ל דכפרה וכ' we are given to understand (by implication) that &c. Ib. ממאי דהאי וכ' whence is it proved that this uba &c.? Ib. b ואינהו דמחשכי וכ' and it was they who (as an exception) worked late and early; a. v. fr.—[This prefix is used for the formation of what may be named Difel nouns, as דְּבֵיתָא, דִּכְמָא &c., a. Dispeel nouns as דִּיסְקַרְתָּא &c.]

sense.definition: (= h. זוֹ, זֹאת) this; with prefix ה, (הֲדָא) הָדָא, cmp. אָדָא I.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. II, 23; a. fr.—Ned. 41 a (prov.) דְּדָא ביה וכ' in whom there is this (wisdom), in him there is everything.—דא ודא this and that, both. Sabb. 52 b ד' וד' (אחת) חדא היא all sorts of rings come under the same law; a. fr.—Y. Succ. I, 52 c top הדא אמרה היא הדא וכ' this proves &c., v. אָדָא I.—הדא היא דכתיב (abbr. הה"ד) it is this which Scripture says, thus we read. Y. Sot. I, 17 b bot.; Gen. R. s. 2; a. v. fr.—Y. Gitt. IV, 45 d bot. introduced his lecture בדה with this.—לא בְדָא not in this case, i.e. the law does not apply to this. Y. Ber. I, 2 b bot.; a. fr.—Y. Taan. II, 66 a bot. לא בדא הלכה וכ' not in this case is the practice in agreement with the anonymous opinion.
Pes. 112 b. [דא, Cant. R. to II, 15, v. בלטוורא.]

sense.definition: to melt, to cause to languish.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 79 a (play on מידבא, Num. XXI, 30) עד שתַּדְאִיב נשמתן (Var. תדיב, תדוב, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 2) until it (the fire of Gehenna) shall melt their soul. Ned. 22 a (ref. to Deut. XXVIII, 65) שמכלה … ומַדְאִיב וכ' which ruins the eyesight and makes life languid. Ch. דְּאֵיב.
Targ. Y. II Deut. XXVIII, 65.

same. Targ. Job XLI, 14 (דאב' fem., h. text דאבה).—Targ. Ps. XIII, 3 דב' Ms. (ed. דוו'; h. text יגון). Targ. Y. Num. XXI, 30 בִּדְבוֹ' (some ed. כְּדָ', h. text דיבון, cmp. B. Bath. 79 a, s. v. דָּאַב); a. e.
Targ. Prov. XVIII, 8 מְדַאַבְנָן ed. Lag. (oth. ed. מרכנן, h. text כמתלהמים).
, v. דּוֹאֵג

sense.definition: (b. h.) [ to melt,] cmp. דאב a. יצף, to be low-spirited, to sorrow, fear.
sense.notes: Snh. 106 b (play on דאג, I Sam. XXI, 8, a. דוֹיֹג, ib. XXII, 18) at first יושב הקב"ה ודוֹאֵג וכ' the Lord sat in anxiety, that he (Doeg) might degenerate; after …, He said ו̇וי̇ שיצא זה woe that he did &c. Ber. 40 a יִדְאַג מריח וכ' must be in fear of contracting &c. Succ. 29 a. Ḥag. 13 a שלבו דואג בקרבו whose heart within him is in fear of sin (reverential). Sabb. 105 b sq. יִדְאֲגוּ כל האחין all the brothers should feel troubled (examine their ways). Midr. Till. to Ps. XLVIII a man committed a sin והיה דואג בלבו and was troubled in his heart; a. fr.
Pirké d’R. El. ch. IV דּוֹאֶה על וכ' (ref. to Ps. XVIII, 11).

sense.definition: v. דַּיָּה) Daah, name of an unclean bird.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 63 b ד' וראה וכ' Daah and Raah and Ayyah and Dayyah are the same genus; Sifré Deut. 103.
= דָּוי, v. דוי, דְּוָא II
, read: רֶאוְמָטִיקוֹס.
, Y. Ab. Zar. V, end, 45 b, v. דָּנִיסְטֵיס
—יותר מִדַּאי more than enough, too much. Keth. 111 a; a. fr.—כְּדַאי, v. כְּדָי.
Targ. Ps. CV, 41 (h. text זוב).—Part. דָּאֵיב, v. דּוּב.
, v. דּוּג, דּוּךְ.
, v. דִּיסְקַרְתָּא
, Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c, v. דָּנִיסְטֵיס
, v. דּוּץ, דּוּר.
, Targ. Prov. XII, 12 some ed., read רָאִיג.
, v. דָּלוּ
, v. דיופלא

sense.definition: name of a species of doves.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 62 a ed. (Ar. דיי').
Targ. Ps. CXXIX, 3 דַּארוּ דַארַיָא ed. Ven. (cmp. Pesh.) the turners turned (planned my destruction, h. text חרשו חרשים; ed. Lag. ראדו ראדייא, oth. ed. רדו רדייא, v. רְדִי).

sense.definition: Daru, name of R. Naḥman’s slave.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 64 b; a. e.
, v. ארז a. אַרְזָא.
Af. אַדְאֵית to bring forth. Targ. C. Gen. I, 11, v. דִּיתְאָה.
, v. דּוֹב
Gen. R. s. 99 לדב כתיב דב היה שמה it reads (Dan. VII, 5) לדב (instead of לדוב)— deb (wolf) was her (Media’s) name (with ref. to Jer. V, 6); Lev. R. s. 13; Esth. R. introd.
, v. דבי
, v. דִּיבָּא

Sifré Deut. 42 (ref. to Deut. XXXIII, 25) כל הארצות דּוֹבְאוֹת כסף וכ' all countries will send their overflow of silver to the land of Israel (to buy fruits); Yalk. Deut. 963; Lev. R. s. 35 ד' כסף ומביאין לא"י. [Sifré l. c. הארצות דובאות למלאות וכ', read באות; cmp. Lev. R. l. c.]

sense.definition: (b. h.) to drip, flow; to murmur, speak lowly, whisper.
sense.notes: Yeb. 97 a (ref. to Cant. VII, 10) מה כומר … מיד דּוֹבֵב as the heated mass of grapes drips as soon as you apply your finger, כך … דּוֹבְבוֹת וכ' so do the lips of scholars in the grave murmur when their names are cited; Snh. 90 b; Bekh. 31 b (Y. Ber. II, 4 b bot. רוחשות, Ar. דובבות); a. e.—2) * to drop pitch. Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 b bot. נכרי עובדן ודוֹבְבָן a gentile may tan them (the leather bottles) and pitch them; [Tosef. ib. IV (V), 10 זופתן ed. Zuck. (Var. רובבן; Bab. ib. 33 a ריבבן; Tosaf. a. l. quotes fr. Tosef. רובד', v. רָבַב a. רָבַד.]

sense.definition: (deriv. of דִּבָּה or דְּבָב) to speak evil, be hostile, only in part. pass.
sense.notes: דָּבוּב, f. דְּבוּבָה. Y. Erub. VII, 24 c bot. a woman שהיתה ד' לחבירתה who was on bad terms with her neighbor (ib. III, 20 d bot. דבי', corr. acc.).— Pl. דְּבוּבִין, דְּבוּבוֹת. Cant. R. to III, 11 two legions ד' זה עם זה hostile to each other. Ib. fire and hail ד' זה וכ' are hostile elements; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 4 a רכו' (corr. acc.).
חזינהו לסיפוותיה דקא דַבְבָן Ar. (prob. quot. of B. Kam. 117 a bot. חזא דפריט' סיפוותיה Ms. M.).

sense.definition: (= דִּבָּה, v. דָּבַב) whisper, evil speech; only in בַּעַל ד', pl. בַּעֲלֵי ד' man of evil speech, i.e. opponent, informer.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to VII, 10 (play on dobeb, ib.) הייתי נעשה בעל ד' וכ' I should have become an opponent of those (patriarchs) sleeping &c. Sifra B’ḥuck. Par. 2, ch. IV בעלי ד' וכ' informers shall surround you from without; Yalk. Lev. 673 בעל דבבא. Sifra Emor, Par. 14, ch. XIX the whole congregation shall act כבעלי ד' לו as if they were his accusers.

Targ. Ps. VIII, 3 (h. text אוֹיֵב); a. fr.—Gitt. 55 b וב' דְּבָבֵיה בר וכ' and his enemy was Bar K., opp. רחמיה.— Pl. בעלי ד', also ב' דְבָבִין, דְבָבַיָּא. Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 24. Ib. XXXVII, 20.—Targ. Lam. I, 2; a. fr. [Sifré Num. 42, v. next w. Yalk. Lev. 637, v. preced.]
f. same. Sifré Num. 42 במקום … ושנאה ובעלי ד' (not דבבא) there (in heavens) where there are neither hatred … nor slanderers; Yalk. ib. 711.
Targ. Gen. III, 5; a. e.—Targ. Is. XIV, 21 ed. Lag. (ed. דבב).

sense.definition: (reduplic. of דבב) lumps of dripping grapes (exposed to heat; v. דָּבַב).
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. II, 7 (39 b) והדבד' (Mish. ed. דברניות, Ms. M. דברבנ'; Y. ed. דכדב', corr. acc.; Mish. Nap. דַּמְדְּמָנִיּוֹת). Y. Sabb. I, 4 a bot.; Y. Bets. II, 62 a top דמדמ'. Cmp. אֲדַמְדְּמָנֵי.
—Trnsf. an ill-reputed woman. Pes. 87 b (play on Diblayim, Hos. I, 3) ד' רעה בת ד' וכ' an ill-reputed woman daughter of &c.; cmp. דּוּמָה I.
Cant. R. to III, 4 כבין ד' לכלב about that stage of the morning when you begin to distinguish between a wolf and a dog (v. Ber. 9 b).
, v. דָּאבוֹנָא
, v. דִּיבּ'
, v. דְּבוֹרְיָא

Yalk. Deut. 795 (play on הדברים, Deut. I, 1) מה הד' הזו בניה מתנהגין וכ' as the bee is followed by the young, so are the Israelites led by the righteous &c.; (Deut. R. s. 1 כדְּבוֹרִים היו וכ' like bees my children were guided &c.). Ib. מה הד' הזו וכ' as the bee whose honey &c.; a. fr.— Pl. דְּבוֹרִים. Kel. XVI, 7 מדף של ד' the vessel used for smoking the bees out. Bekh. 7 b דבש ד' bee-honey. Deut. R. l. c., v. supra.

sense.definition: pr. n. f. Deborah, the heroine and prophetess.
sense.notes: Meg. 14 a; a. fr.—שִׁירַת ד' the song of Deborah (Jud. V). Y. Meg. III, 74 b bot.; Treat. Sof’rim XII, 10; a. e.

B. Bath. 108 a (in Hebr. Diction). הרחק חרדלך מדְּבוֹרְיִי Rashi (ed. מן דְּבוֹרָאִי, Ms. F. a. R. דבורי) remove thy mustard plants from my bee-hive. Ib. דְּבוֹרְיָיךְ Rashi (ed. דבורך).— Pl. דְּבוֹרְיָין. Y. Peah VII, 20 b top דבש דד' bee-honey.
, v. דַּבַּרְתָּא
Targ. Ps. LIV, 8; a. fr.
same. Targ. Ex. V, 8; a. fr.

Targ. II Kings V, 17. Targ. Prov. XXI, 3; a. e.— Pl. דִּבְחִין, דִּבְחַיָּא, דִּיבְ'. Targ. Num. XXV, 2 דִּבְחֵי (some ed. O. דַּבְּ'). Targ. II Sam. XV, 12; a. fr.—Esp. the feast of Passover. Sabb. 110 a בין ד' לעצרתא between Passover and Pentecost.

sense.definition: (= דְּוָא) to look out, lie in wait.
sense.notes: — Pa. דַּבֵּי to lurk for, hunt. Sabb. 106 b הני לא בעי דַּבּוּיֵי Ms. M. (ed. לא עבידי לרבויי) the ones need no hunting; Bets. 24 a בעיין לדַ' Ms. M. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; ed. עבידי לר'), v. רְבִי.
, v. דָּבַב II

sense.definition: excrements, a softer expression in the K’ri instead of the Kethib חריינים (II Kings VI, 25).
sense.notes: Meg. 25 b

sense.definition: a thick viscid mass, cake of pressed figs; fig used for pressing.
sense.notes: Pes. 87 b (play on Diblayim, Hos. I, 3) she was sweet in the mouth of all כד' like figs; הכל … כד' all trod upon her as figs are trodden upon. Gen. R. s. 31 הכניס עמו ד' he took the provision with him in a pressed state; רוב מִכְנָסוֹ ד' most of his storage was &c. Yoma 76 a; Tosef. Ker. I, 20, a. e. ד' קעילית preserved figs from Keilah (which are intoxicating). Y. Bicc. III, beg. 65 c ד', opp. גרוגרות; a. fr.— Pl. דְּבֵילוֹת. Naz. 9 a (alternating with sing.).
Targ. Jud. IX, 11 (h. text תנובה); a. e.— Pl. דִּיבְלִין. Targ. I Chr. XII, 40.—דְּבֵילָתָא, דִּבְלָ'. Targ. I Sam. XXX, 12 (some ed. sing.). Targ. Y. Num. XXXIII, 46.
same. Y. Dem. II, 22 c
, v. דְּבֵק
Ex. R. s. 33 דרך דְּבִיקָתָן in the position of their embrace.
Gen. R. s. 80; Midr. Till. to Ps. XXII בד' with the expression דבק (ref. to Deut. IV, 4).

sense.definition: the Holy of Holies in the Temple.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IV, 8 c top.

sense.definition: the Book, a word in use among the Persian Jews.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 24 b (ref. to Jud. I, 11).
, v. דִּיבּוּרָא

sense.definition: (Difel noun of בֵּיתָא, v. letter ד) [ of the house,] wife, only with suff.
sense.notes: of person. pron. דְּבִיתְהוּ ד־ the wife of. Ber. 27 b. Taan. 23 b ד' דמר your wife; a. v. fr.—דְּבִיתְכִי thy wife. Ned. 51 a
, Targ. Is. XXXIV, 4, some ed., read נִבְלָא.
, v. דְּבֵילָה

sense.definition: , pl. רַּבְלוּלִין (denom. of דְּבֵלָה, cmp. σῦκον, συκῆ, ficus) piles, excrescences ; trnsf. lumps.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. IX, 2 היו ד' יוצאין וכ' (cmp. מֵעַיִין ib.) if lumps of upholstery protrude from the couch. Ib. VII, 11 היו ד' … הימנה if lumps or irregular pieces of reeds hang down from the matting.—Denom. מְדוּבְלָל a) lumpy. Bekh. III, 4 הצמר המ' (Talm. ed. 25 b המדולדל) the clumps in the wool.—b) (cmp. Arab. dubal) melancholy, miserable-looking. Succ. II, 2 סוכה המְדוּבְלֶלֶת a miserable looking Succah, expl. ib. 22 a (by Rab) as ענייה or מדולדלת (Y. ib. 52 b bot. מדוללת, v. דָּלַל a. דִּלְדֵּל) beggarly, thinned; (by Samuel) as קנה עולה וקנה יורד or מבולבלת disarranged.
, part. pass. מְדוּבְלָל, v. preced.
, v. דְּבִילְתָּא

B. Bath. 91 b, v. infra.—Yalk. Gen. 133 דבקו כל החיל וכ' the whole army was close to the fortress.—Ib. Deut. 824 ד' לסדומיים he joined the Sodomites.—2) to join, glue, affix. Y. Meg. I, 71 d top דּוֹבְקִין בְּדֶבֶק the parchment is joined with glue.— Part. pass. דָּבוּק, f. דְּבוּקָה attached, close, cleaving. Sot. 42 b (ref. to Ruth I, 14) בני הדבוקה the descendants of her who was attached (to Naomi). Gen. R. s. 20 דְּבוּקִין לעור close to the skin. Snh. 64 a (ref. to Deut. IV, 4) like two dates הדְּבוּקִים וכ' which stick to one another (easily separated); ib. דבוקים ממש really glued (inseparable); Yalk. Deut. 824 כשתי … הדְּבוּקוֹת; a. fr.

Keth. 111 b; Yalk. l. c. is it possible for man לִידָּבֵק וכ' to be joined to the Divine Majesty? Ib. כאילו נ' כשכינה (Keth. l. c. מִדַּבֵּק) as though he were joined. B. Bath. 91 b ששבה ונִדְבְּקָה וכ' (Ms. H. ודָבְקָה) (Ruth) who came back and remained attached to Bethlehem (v. supra); a. fr.
R. Hash, III. 6 (27 a, b).

sense.definition: to invite one to join in travel.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 29 ראה אחד ודִיבְּקוֹ he saw a person and made him go with him.—Part. pass. מְדוּבָּק Yalk. Deut. l. c. שמְדוּבָּקִים לחייו וכ' who cling to the Life of the World (the Lord).
Pes. 37 a הרתיח ולבסוף ה' he heated the pot and then pasted the dough to its wall. Ib. b

Gen. R. s. 59 אין ארור מִתְדַּבֵּק בברוך (Yalk. Hos. 528 מִדַּבֵּק) the cursed (Eliezer) shall not be joined (through marriage) to the blessed (Isaac). Keth. l. c., v. Nif.—Yalk. Deut. l. c. מִדַּבֶּקֶת; a. fr. [Sabb. 113 b [read:] לִידַּבֵּק עם הנשים or לדבר, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note.]
Targ. Prov. XVIII, 24 דָּבֵיק ed. Lag.; a. e.—Keth. 111 b וכי אפשר לדְבוּקֵי, v. preced. Nif.
Men. 11 a דַּבְּקֵיה לקומץ וכ' if he pasted the handfull of dough to the wall of the vessel.

Targ. Ruth I, 14; a. fr.—Gitt. 56 b מהו לאִידְּבוּקֵי בהו how about joining their ranks?—Pes. 49 a לאִידְּבַק אנא בזרעיה Ms. M. (ed. דאדבק בזרעיה) that I should be connected with his descendants. Sabb. 113 b. Gen. R. s. 14 אית חספין מִתְדַּבְּקִין can broken earthen vessels be joined together?

sense.definition: to reach, overtake, attain to, obtain (corresp. to h. הִשִּׂיג).
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXXI, 23. Targ. O. Lev. XIV, 21 sq.; a. fr.—Part. pass. מַדְבַּק joined work. Targ. I Kings VII, 29 (h. text ליות; v. 30 עובד דיבוק).

sense.definition: to join (plans), to contrive fraud (nectere dolos; h. text הצמיד).
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. L, 19 (Ms. Pa.).
Y. Meg. I, 71 d top, v. דָּבַק. Sabb. VIII, 4, v. שַׁבְשֶׁבֶת.
Ḥull. 50 a מקום הד' the place where the entrails adhere to the hip.— Pl. דְּבָקִים followers. Yalk. Deut. 824 אתם ודִבְקֵיכֶם ye and your followers.

Pl. as above; constr. דִּבְקֵי, דִּיבְ'.—ד' מיתה duties the neglect of which is the cause of premature death. Sabb. 32 a (a Variant of בדקי, v. בֶּדֶק); Y. ib. II, 5 b bot.; Tosef. ib. II, 10 דיבק ed. Zuck. (corr. acc.); Ber. 31 b

sense.definition: (b. h.) to join, arrange, lead (the flock); v. next w.

sense.notes: Ber. 31 b, a. fr. דִּבְּרָה תורה כלשון ב"א the Torah speaks according to the language of men, i.e. uses metaphors and phrases adapted to human understanding. Sot. 12 b שעתיד לְדַבֵּר וכ' destined to speak to Divinity. Ter. I, 2 חרש שדִּבְּרוּ … מְדַבֵּר wherever the scholars use the word ḥ çrçsh, they mean one who neither hears nor talks. Mekh. Bo 7, end, a. fr. או אינו מְדַבֵּר אלא ב־ or does perhaps the text speak only of—? [מְדַבֵּר as a noun, v. s. v.].
Mekh. Bo, introd. לא נ' עמו וכ' the Lord did not hold communion with him outside the capital of Egypt. Ib. fr.

sense.definition: , same, esp. part. f. מִדַּבֶּרֶת being on terms of intimacy with a man.
sense.notes: Keth. I, 8 ראוה מד' עם אחד (omit בשוק); expl. ib. 13 a. Ib. VII, 6 מד' עם כל אדם she is intimate with everybody. Ib. לכשהיא מד' בתוך ביתה וכ' when her neighbors can hear her voice in moments of intimacy with her husband.

sense.definition: to make submissive, persuade, v. דִּיבּוּר.
sense.notes: Macc. 11 a דִבֵּר לחוד יַדְבֵּר לחוד the Piel dibber has one meaning (speaking harshly), and the Hif. yadber another.
Targ. Gen. XIX, 15; a. fr. (h. לקח).—Ib. XXXI, 18; a. fr. (h. נהג).
Erub. 14 b, a. e. פוק חזי מאי עמא ד' go out and see how the people conduct themselves (what the religious usage is). Koh. R. to IX, 10, v. כְּלוּם.

Targ. O. Ex. III, 1 ed. Berl. (ed. דְּבַר). Ib. XIV, 21 (ed. דְּבַר, h. text ויולך). Targ. Ez. XVI, 12; a. e.—Keth. 62 b sq. עד כמה קא מְדַבְּרַת אלמנות חיים how long yet wilt thou lead a life of living widowhood (separation from a living husband)?
Targ. Ezek. XXXIII, 6; a. e.
Targ. Is. XIV, 2; a. fr.—Bets. 21 b אַדְבְּרֵיה וכ' took him out on a walk; ib. 29 a. Y. Yeb. XIII, 13 c bot. מַדְבְּרוּן לה גבר they introduce to her a suitor.
. Targ. Prov. XXIV, 11. Targ. Ez. XXXIII, 6. Targ. II Kings II, 9 sq.; a. e.
Targ. Gen. XXXIII, 14 אֵידַבַּר ed. Berl. (h. text אתנהלה).

B. Bath. 56 b (ref. to Deut. XIX, 15) ד' ולא חצי ד' a statement (testimony) but not a partial statement. Mekh. Bo, introd. היה הד' לאהרן (Tanḥ. ib. 5 דבור) the word of the Lord came to &c.; a. fr.—דְּבַר תורה according to the Biblical law. Erub. 81; a. fr.— Pl. דְּבָרִים, constr. דִּבְרֵי. ד' תורה Biblical laws; ד' סופרים Rabbinical laws. Ib. Yeb. IX, 3; a. fr.—ד' קבלה prophetic exhortations or incidental utterances in other Biblical books than the Pentateuch. Ḥag. 10 b; Nidd. 23 a; a. e.—B. Mets. 49 a; Bekh. 13 b ד' יש בהם משום מחוסרי אמנה to word of mouth the rules concerning the faithless are applied, i.e. a verbal agreement is morally binding. B. Mets. 48 a הנושא ונותן בד' וכ' he who contracts verbally has no legal claim. Ib. ד' ואיכא … קאי באבל he who retracts a verbal transaction with which a payment of money was connected, comes under the category of those against whom the words ‘but the scholars declared’ (ib. IV,

sense.definition: has been pronounced.—דִּבְרֵי הַיָּמִים the Book of Chronicles.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 1. B. Bath. 14 b.—דָּבָר אַחֵר (abbrev. ד"א) another interpretation (is this). Gen. R. s. 1, beg.; a. fr.—2) thing, affair, object, occurrence &c. Sot. 28 b ד' שיש בו דעת לישאל an object which has sense to ask, i.e. a rational being, opp. ד' שאין וכ' dumb creatures &c.—Num. R. s. 11 ד' שבינך לבינו that which concerns only thy relation to God; v. בֵּין.—ד' שבממון a monetary affair. B. Mets. 94 a; a. fr.—ד' הלמד מענינו a thing (law) derived from the context on the very subject. Sifra, introd.; a. fr.—ד' אחר (abbr. ד"א) something not to be named, a) idolatry. Men. XIII, 10 ואין צריך לומר לד"א much less priests who have been offering to idols; a. fr.—b) swine. Ber. 43 b (prov.) תלה ליה קורא לד"א וכ' hang a palm shoot around the swine and it will follow its habits (of wallowing in the mud). Sabb. 129 a sq.; a. e.—c) leprosy Ib. אי פגע בד"א קשה לד"א if he meets a swine (after blood letting), he is in danger of becoming a leper.—d) unchaste conduct, sexual intercourse, sodomy &c. Ib. 17 b על בנותיהן משום ד"א ועל ד"א משום ד"א they forbade connection with their daughters on account of idolatry, and decreed something else (that a gentile child should be unclean as though afflicted with gonorrhœa) on account of sodomy. Ber. 8 b צנועין בד"א chaste in marital life; a. fr.— Pl. as above.—בעל ד' the person to deal with, opponent, party. B. Mets. 14 a לאו ב"ד דידי את I have nothing to do with thee; a. fr.—לא היו ד' מעולם there were no such things, I deny it outright. Shebu. 41 b; a. fr.—ד' בגב, ד' בגו, v. גַּב, גֵּו.

sense.definition: , esp. Targ. Ez. XXXIII, 6) death, pestilence.
sense.notes: Ab. V, 8. Sabb. 33 a; a. fr.—Esp. the plague of pestilence in Egypt. Ex. R. s. 12. Tanḥ. Vaëra 14; a. fr.
— Pl. דַּבָּרִין. Snh. 8 a ד' אחד וכ' a generation must have one leader, but not two.

sense.definition: (דבר, cmp. נָהַג) drive, way of moving.
sense.notes: Targ. II Kings IX, 20.— Pl. דַּבָּרִין. Targ. Jud. V, 20 כבשי ד' (h. text מְסִלּוֹת).
Taan. 4 b. Ab. Zar. 68 b בדד' concerning a field mouse; a. e.
Targ. Y. Deut. IV, 43 (h. text גּוֹלָן).
Ab. Zar. 47 a לד' דנהרא וכ' Ms. M. a. Rashi (ed. לדברונה דמיא) he worships the current of the river (the whole connection from its source to its mouth).
, Yalk. Gen. 22 ד' דמיא, v. זַכְרוּתָא
Midr. Till. to Ps. XXII, 6; Yalk. Jud. 42; Ps. 686 (play on דבורה) חשיך דרא דאתתא ד' poor is the generation whose leader is a woman.
Yalk. Gen. 151 למה אתה ד' why art thou the spokesman?
Targ. Y. Ex. IV, 10.
Gen. R. s. 18, beg.— Pl. דַּבְּרָנִיּוֹת. Ber. 48 b. Gen. R. s. 45; Deut. R. s. 6; a. e. [Ab. Zar. II, 7, v. דַּבְדְּבָנִיּוֹת].
Targ. Num. XXXI, 11; a. e.
Taan. 21 b
Pl. דַּבַּרְיָתָא, דְּבוֹרְיָתָא. Targ. O. a. Y. II Deut. I, 44. Targ. Jud. XIV, 8.—דַּבָּרֵי. Y. Sabb. I, 3 b

sense.definition: , Hif. הִדְבִּישׁ to become liquid, to ferment (of honey).
sense.notes: B. Mets. 38 a. Snh. 101 a. Sabb. 154 b

sense.definition: preced.) glutinous substance, honey (of bees, dates &c.).
sense.notes: Bekh. 7 b. Ter. XI, 2 ד' תמרים; a. fr.
, v. דּוּבְשָׁא
Targ. Y. I, II Num. XXXII, 34. Targ. Y. ib. 3 מד' (O. מלבשתא ed. Amst., ed. Berl. דיבון).

ד' טמא unclean fish, forbidden in dietary laws, ד' טהור clean, permitted. Bekh. I, 2; a. fr.— Pl. דָּגִים. Ḥull. VIII, 1; a. fr.—M. Kat. 25 b דְּגֵי רקק, v. לִוְיָתָן.—מַזַּל דָּגִים (or without מזל) The Fishes, Pisces, twelfth sign of the Zodiac. Pesik. R. s. 20; a. e.; v. גְּדִי.

all kind of fish, pieces of fish. Ned. 51 b if one says, ‘I will taste no דג, he is forbidden to eat large fish &c.; if he says דגה he is forbidden small fish &c. Ib. ד' משמע גדולים וכ' dagah implies both large and small (in Biblical language), but in vows the popular usage is followed. Y. Bets. II, 61 b top; a. fr.

sense.definition: (preced., v. דּוּגִית) fisher boat, light shallow-going boat.
sense.notes: Pl. דְּגוּגִין. Targ. Is. XVIII, 2 (Var. דְּגוּגְיָן).
— Pl. דְּגוּגְיָתָא. Targ. Am. IV, 2 דְּגוּגְיַת (Var. דגוגִית, דוּגִית sing.).
, v. דִּיגּוּל
, v. דֶּגֶל

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. Dagon, name of the Philistean god.
sense.notes: Tosef. Sabb. VII (VIII), 2 דגן על שם ע"ז וכ' Dagan (in the charm Dagan v’Kidron) reminds of idolatry, as it is said &c. (Jud. XVI, 23). Y. ib. VI, 8 c bot. [read:] ד' משום ע"ז.

Targ. O. Gen. XXXI, 46. Targ. Hab. III, 15 (piled up waves, h. text חֹמֶר).— Pl. דְּגוֹרִין. Targ. O. Ex. VIII, 10; a. e.—[Y. Kil. I, 27 a top חסדיגרון, read חס דגורין, R. S. to Kil. I, 2 חסא דאיגרין, cler. error, for דדגורין; v. חָסָא.]

sense.definition: (דָּגַר b. h.) brooding, the expression דגר.
sense.notes: Hull. 140 b אתיא ד' ד' there is an analogy betwen dagar (Jer. XVII, 1

sense.definition: Pi. דִּגֵּל, דִּיגֵּל (denom. of דֶּגֶל) to outgeneral, play tricks (cmp. στραταγέω a. καταστραταγέω).
sense.notes: Cant. R. to II, 4 (play on ודגלו ib.) אפי' אותן הַדִּיגּוּלִין שדִּיגֵּל … באביו even those devices with which Jacob deceived his father.

Sabb. 63 a (play on ודגלו, v. supra) two students המַדְגִּילִים זה לזה וכ' who outwit each other with sophistries (Tosaf. to Ab. Zar. 22 b). [Rashi: who form an assembly (דֶּגֶל) for studies, in the absence of a teacher.]
Targ. Prov. XVI, 10 לא נְדַגֵּיל פומיה Ar. (ed. נִדְגוּל) his mouth is not tricky (h. text מעל).

דָּגוּל, v. דֶּגֶל.— Nif. נִדְגַּל (denom. of דֶּגֶל) to be divided in troops, arranged. Part. pl. f. נִדְגָּלוֹת those arranged in troops, the hosts of heaven. Num. R. s. 2 (ref. to Cant. VI, 4) ובמה אתם כנ' and wherein do ye (Israelites) resemble the angels?; Yalk. Cant. 992.

sense.definition: to put up a flag, to signalize.
sense.notes: Tanḥ., ed. Bub., B’midb. 15 (ref. to Cant. II, 4) ולוי הוא מַדְגִּיל עלי אהבה (Tanḥ. ib. 14; Num. R. l. c. מגדיל) Oh, that He would let the flag of love wave over me!
Sabb. 63 a, v. דָּגַל I.

sense.definition: (b. h.) troop, division, cohort (cmp. caterva) ; standard.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to II, 4 ודִגְלוֹ Michael and his band (of angels); a. e.— Pl. דְּגָלִים. Num. R. s. 2 והיו כולם עשויים ד' ד' וכ' and all of them (the angels) were arranged in divisions, as it is said (Cant. V, 10) dagul (surrounded by divisions) of a myriad each (with ref. to Ps. LXVIII, 18). Ib. עֲשֵׂה אותם ד' וכ' divide them into cohorts as they desired (with ref. to Num. II, 2); v. Cant. R. to II, 4; Tanḥ. B’midb. 10.—Ex. R. s. 15 אין ד' אלא צבאות d’galim means hosts. Ib. דִּגְלֵי השמים … וד' הארץ וכ' the heavenly hosts are the angels, the earthly hosts (of the Lord) are Israel. Ib. s. 24, end; a. fr.—Sabb. 5 a; 98 a דומה לדִגְלֵי מדבר resembling the marches of the Israelites in the desert.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) a carrying pole in the shape of a standard, Ar. (ed. a. Mss. mostly רִגְלָא, רִיגְ' q. v.) Bets. 30 a.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 83 a (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, a. to Sabb. 148 a).

Targ. Prov. XIX, 28 דיגא' ed. Lag. (oth. ed. דגל', ר'). Ib. XXIV, 28 (h. text חנם). Ib. XX, 17 (h. text שקר).—Ab. Zar. 22 b (prov.) מכתבא … ד' בחבריה ידע Ar. (ed. a. Ms. M. רגלא) the pencil splits the stone (marble), a schemer finds out his like.
, Koh. R. to V, 12 ד' פטרגוס, a corrupt. arising fr. two Var. to ערטיל ibid., פודגרוס a. פודלגוס (ποδαγρός, ποδαλγός); cmp. Y. Kidd. I, 61 a; Sot. 10 a; Tanḥ. Masé 12.
Targ. Prov. XVII, 4 ed. Lag. (Var. ר'). Ib. XXX, 8 דיגלתא ed. Lag. (Var. ריג'); v. דַּגָּלָא.
, v. דִּיגְלָת
, v. דּוּגְמָא
, v. דוגמטרין

sense.definition: v. next w.) pile; grain, bread, bread-stuff.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 10 דְּגָנוֹ של עולם are the store of the world. Tosef. Ber. IV, 15; Y. ib. VI, 10 b הד' שהוא וכ' the more preferable kind of bread. Tosef. l. c. כל שהוא מין שבע ואינו מין ד' whatever belongs to the seven produces (Deut. VIII, 8) but not to breadstuffs; Bab. ib. 37 b. Pes. III, 1; a. fr.—Ned. VII, 2 הנודר מן הד' וכ' he who vows abstinence from dagan, is forbidden dry Egyptian beans, v. next w.— Pl. דְּגָנִים. Pesik. R. s. 41 מנפף את הד' swells the grains; (Yalk. Ps. 755 מנפנף את רגליה, read דְּגָנֶיהָ). Tosef. Ber. VII (VI), 8 Var.—בֵּית דָּ' pr. n. pl. Beth-Dagan in Judea. Tosef. Ohol. III, 9. [Tosef. Sabb. VII (VIII), 2, v. דָּגוֹן.]

sense.definition: , Ithpe. אִידְּגַן to be piled up, stored.
sense.notes: Ned. 55 a shall we judge (fr. R. Meir’s opinion VII, 2, v. preced.) כל דמִידְּגַן משמע dagan implies everything which is piled up?—Ber. 47 b; Bets. 13 b האי (אִדְּ') אי' וכ' the one (the piled up) has become dagan, the other (standing in the ears) is not yet dagan (with ref. to Num. XVIII, 27).

Targ. Y. Ex. XXIII, 19 (cmp. Tanḥ. R’eh 17 s. v. גְּדִי).—Y. Ned. VII, 40 c top (ref. to R. Meir’s opinion ib. VII, 2, v. preced.) דְגָנָהּ דארעא dry Egyptian beans are the bread of the land (Palestine, therefore implied in dagan); (ref. to the Rabbis’ opinion, ib.) דגנה מעבורה ‘its bread’ means its home growth.
Targ. Job XXXIX, 14.

sense.definition: to be piled up (of bowels in pain).
sense.notes: Targ. Lam. I, 20. Ib. II, 11 אידגארן ed. Lag. (h. text חמרמר, cmp. דְּגוֹרָא = חֹמֶר).
Ḥull. 51 a ד' נפל מאיגרא (our w. omitted in Ar. s. v. איפומא) it leaped [and] fell from the roof (Rashi).
, v. דּוֹד

sense.definition: (b. h.; = דודו, v. דוה; cmp. דְּהֵין) breast, nipple, teat.
sense.notes: Sabb. 144 b. Sifré Num. 89; Tosef. Sot. IV, 3 (ed. Zuck. שד); a. e.—Trnsf. spigot. Yoma III, 10.— Pl. דַּדִּים. Ber. 10 a. Y. Yeb. II, 3 d; a. fr.

Ab. Zar. 26 a she may smear poison לד' מאבראי on her breast outside.— Pl. דַּדִּין, דַּדַּיָּא. Targ. Is. XXXII, 12 (ed. Lag. תדין).—Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד מאת' 6) ותרין מזגין אילין תרין דדיא (not דדא) the two bottlers (in the riddle) are the two breasts. Gen. R. s. 98 יתברכון ד' וכ' blessed are the breasts which nursed such a son.
, v. דִּידְבָא
, v. דּוֹד
, v. דדי
, v. דְּחוּכָא
, v. דְּהַן II
, v. דּוּדָא
— Pl. דִּדָּה

sense.definition: to walk, pull (a young child or beast unable to walk by itself).
sense.notes: Sabb. XVIII, 2 מְדַדִּין עגלין וכ' you may lead or pull calves &c. (on the Sabbath). Ib. אשה מְדַדָּה וכ' a mother may walk her child. Ib. 128 b דוחין אין מדדין לא push you may, but make them hop, no. Pes. IV, 7 (55 b) מְדַרִּין ומחזירין וכ' Ar. (ed. only מחזירין). Sabb. 88 b and the angels מְדַדִּין אותך led them (the frightened Israelites) back; א"ת ידודון אלא יְדַדּוּן read not (Ps. LXVIII, 13) yiddodun but y’daddun (they led them). Cant. R. to VIII, 11 the angels מְדַדִּין להם וכ' led the Israelites away, והיו מִדַּדִּין לפני וכ' and they themselves tripped timidly before the Lord, v. infra. Y. Sabb. XVII, end, 16 b; Y. Erub. X, 26 c top מְדַדֵּהוּ וכ' he makes the bolt slide with his finger tips. Cant. R. to IV, 8 [read:] אדין מְדַדֵּם ואינם וכ' He had just been leading them (through the Red Sea), and they should not trust?—ד' פיתקין to shake stones ( ballots), i.e. to protest against. Esth. R. to I, 2 מה"ש מְדַדִּין פיתקין וכ' the angels protested against the Lord’s decision; Cant. R. to VIII, 11 יִדּוֹדוּן בהם ממדדין פיטקין (read מדדין) they (the angels) were excited against them, they protested (ref. to Joel IV, 3).

sense.definition: to hop, trip (of young or tied birds).
sense.notes: B. Mets. 25 b אי מִידַּדִּין Ms. M. (ed. אי בְמִדַּ') if the tied birds (deposited in a certain place) hop from spot to spot. B. Bath. 23 b; Bets. 11 a
Sabb. 128 b דַּדּוּיֵי מְדַרִּינָן pull them we may, opp. עקר.

sense.definition: as preced. Hithpa. B. Bath. 24 as preced. Hithpa. B. Bath. 24 a כל דמִידַּדֵּי וכ' any young bird which hops, will hop only within sight of its nest.
sense.notes: Bets. 11 a אִידַּדּוּיֵי אִידַּדּוּ they came hopping (from the nest). Sabb. 99 b דלא לִדַּדּוּ וכ' that the boards should not shake.
Y. Kidd. III, 64 a top כיני אורחא דזבונה מִדַּדְיָיה it is the habit of traders to travel from place to place.
, Y. Sabb. II, beg. 4 c, v. דְּרִינון
, v. דִּידְכֵי
, Lam. R. to II, 2, v. דּוֹדָא

sense.definition: (b. h.) Dedanites, a nomadic tribe on the borders of Idumaea.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Yithro 5.—V. דּוֹדָנִים.

sense.definition: , Y. R. Hash. II, 58 a top, expl. עצי שמן (Mish. ib. II,
, prob. דָּדִינִין (δᾴδινος, pl.) pine-wood, (used for torches; Bab. ib. 23 a אפרסמא; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Taeda).

sense.notes: , v. דְּרָרָא I
, v. דְּרוֹקֶרֶת
, v. דָּא

sense.definition: (cmp. זהב, צהב) to be red (or yellow).
sense.notes: — Hif. הִדְהִיב to redden, make red ( with anger). Lev. R. s. 15, end (play on madhebah, Is. XIV, 4) שהיא מַדְהֶבֶת וכ' that reddens with indignation the face of every one coming near her.

Targ. Gen. II, 11; a. e.—Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c bot. קופד דד' a golden piece resembling meat; Tam. 32 a; a. fr.—B. Mets. 70 a; B. Bath. 166 a ד' פריכא broken pieces of gold (for the melting pot). Ib. 165 b ד' אין פחות וכ' if a note has the word ‘gold’ (without any further definition), it means no less than a Denar in gold (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
Ḥag. 2 a
Targ. II Esth. III, 11 (ed. Lag. ר', corr. acc.).
— Pl. דְּהָבִין. Cant. R. to V, 5 דהבים (corr. acc.).
Y. Gitt. IV, 46 a
Taan. 7 b Ms. M. (ed. דִּי').

sense.definition: (v. דְּהֵין) fattening substance, urin-soaked dung; a concrete of dung used for vessels, cmp. גָּלָל.
sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 b bot. אהן ד' של מימי וכ' a vessel made of dung prepared with urin absorbs no liquids.—Gen. R. s. 39, end (ref. to Bethel, changed into Beth-aven, Josh. VII, 2) [read:] לא זכתה … בית העמל הרי … בית העמד תמן קריין לפועלא טבא עמילא (ולהִרְהוּן) ולדהון … עמידה she did not deserve even to be named Beth Heamal (house of toil, cmp. עמל ואון Ps. XC, 10), now she is named Beth-Heamad (dung-house); there (in Samaria, Galilee &c.) they call the good laborer amela (the industrious, v. עמל), and the dung prepared with urin amidah (concrete, cmp. עָמַד Hif.); Y. Sabb. IX, 11 d; Y. Ab. Zar. III, 43 a bot.; Yalk. Josh. 17 (v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v. הרהון).
= דְּחַךְ. Targ. Job XI, 3. Targ. Ps. II, 4 ed. Lag.
dialectically with רהן, cmp. רוה) to drip, to be fat (corresp. to h. דָּשַׁן a. רָוָה). Targ. Prov. XI, 25 תדהן ed. Lag. (Var. תודכן, תורכן, corr. acc.); a. fr.
. Targ. Ps. XXIII, 5. Targ. Prov. XV, 30; a. e.
Targ. Y. Deut. XXXI, 20.—[Targ. Ps. XX, 4, v. דַהְנַאן.]
Targ. Is. XXXIV, 6.—Shebu. 47 b, v. next w.
Shebu. 47 b קרב לגבי ר' ואִידַּהֵין go near a fat man, and be fat.— Pl. דְּהִינִין. Targ. Ps. XCII, 15. Ib. XXII, 30 (Var. רה').
, v. דּהֲנוּנִיתָא
, v. דְּחֵיךְ
, v. דּוֹחֲכָא
Targ. Ps. XXXVI, 9 (Var רהן). Targ. Is. LV, 2 ed. Bxt. בד' (ed. Lag. a. oth. בדִדְהֵין; cmp. דּידְבָא).

sense.definition: (denom. of preced.; cmp. דַּאֲבַן) to consider fat, to accept.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XX, 4 (ed. Wil. יְדַהֵן; h. text יְדַּשְּׁנֶה).
Targ. Ez. XXXII, 6 (ed. Lag. דוה').

תמרתא ד' (a fat-land date) a species of dates of strong
perfume. Keth. 61 a דהנ'; Sot. 49 a דחינ' (corr. דהינ'). Ib. ריחא דחינ' (read דדהינ') the flavor of a d’hinunitha
, v. דחק

sense.definition: (= רְּהוּ, cmp. דִּי) who, which is, since he, it, &c. Y. Sabb. XIX, beg. 16 d דו אמר … הוא דאמר the same that says …, says also &c. Y. Peah I, 15 c top בגין דו בעי וכ' because he wants to teach &c. Y. Maasr. I, 49 a bot. מן דו from the time that.
sense.notes: Y. Gitt. IX, 50 c top nobody says ‘even’ אלא דו מודה וכ' except he admits the preceding; a. fr.
Y. Naz. IV, end, 53 c. Y. Erub. V, 22 c top דו ואַלְפַּיִם itself (the whole area of the town) and two thousand cubits beside.

sense.definition: (δύο, only in certain compounds) two, double.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 14, beg. דו פרצופין נברא Adam was created with two faces (male and female persons combined); Gen. R. s. 8, beg. דיו; Ber. 68 a; a. e.—Ex. R. s. 5 דו פרצ' היה יוצא the word of the Lord went forth in two characters (killing and reviving). V. דְּיוֹ II.
, v. דְּוִי
the servant of Saul. Snh. 106 b; a. e.
one D. ben Joseph. Lam. R. to I, 16; Sifra B’ḥuck. ch. VI.
, Pa. of דּוּר I ch.
Tanḥ. Ekeb 11 ד' שהיה מהלך וכ' a cursor who travelled with an ordinance in his hand. Sabb. 19 a קביע ד' במתא Ms. M. (ed. בי ד') the mail-carrier (ed. the post office) is permanently located in town.

sense.definition: (Pers. dâvar, judge, ruler, Fl.) בֵּי ד' the (Persian) circuit court consisting of regular law scholars, opp. דייני דמגיסתא squires in country places ignorant of the law.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 114 a (Ms. R. אַבֵּי ד' in the &c., Ms. M. בודאור, corr. acc.). Gitt. 58 b כיון דאיכא בי ד' וכ' since there exists (in Persia) a lawful court, and he did not sue (the tax officer). Ab. Zar. 26 a נקיטא לי זימנא לבי ד' I am summoned to court (and have no time). [In later Hebr. literature בי דואר is used in the sense of post-office.]

sense.definition: (cmp. preced.) davvar, a species of lizard.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 15 end [prob. to be read עָרוֹד, v. Ḥull. 127 a, or חֲוַורְבָּר, v. Sifra Sh’mini ch. VI, Par. 5].

Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 20 (Var. ודָיְיבַן). Targ. Lev. XV, 25 יִרּוֹב.—Part. דָּאִיב, דָּיֵיב. Ib. 33.—Ḥull. 8 b bot.—Pes. 74 b מֵרַב דָּיֵיב it drips. Nidd. 22 a עד דמידב ד' it must be fluid. Ḥull. 133 a
Kidd. 72 a; Ab. Zar. 2 b; Meg. 11 a (used of Persians, ref. to Dan. VII, 5).—Allegorically: temptation. Num. R. s. 13; a. e., v. גָּרָה.— Pl. דּוּבִּים. Snh. 107 b

Targ. II Sam. XVII, 8. Targ. Is. XI, 7 (some ed. דיבא, corr. acc.).—Kidd. 72 a. Taan. 25 a.—Gen. R. s. 87, beg. הא ד' קמך here is the temptation before thee.— Pl. דּוּבִּין, דּוּבֵּי. Targ. II Kings II, 24.—Taan. l. c.; B. Mets. 106 a.—[דּוּבָא, דּוֹבָא wolf, v. דֵּיבָא.] [Targ. I Kings XIV, 28, v. דּוּכָא.]
Targ. Lev. XV, 2 sq. [Targ. Y. ib. 3 דְּיֵיה, read דְּוָיֵה]; a. e.

sense.definition: Dubbiël (bear-god), the genius of the Persians (v. דּוֹב).
sense.notes: Yoma 77 a, v. אִיסְרָא II.

sense.definition: (v. דְּבֵילָה) a species of figs or sycamore.
sense.notes: Pl. דּוּבְלֵי. Ber. 40 b (defin. בנות שקמה). [דובלא, Sot. 10 a, v. יַבְלָא.]

sense.definition: (v. דּוֹבָא) = h. זָב, one afflicted with gonorrhœa.
sense.notes: Targ. Lev. XV, 4; 7; a. e.
, v. דִּיבְקָא
Deut. R. s. 1 דּוּבְשָׁהּ לבעלה what honey the bee produces, belongs to its owner; Yalk. ib. 795. [Ḥall. I, 4 דובשין, Mish. ed., v. דּוּבְשָׁן.]
m. ch. = h. דְּבַשׁ. Targ. Jud. XIV, 8; a. fr.—Ber. 37 b. Ib. 38 a ד' דתמרי date honey; a. e.—Yoma 83 b some ed. דיבשא.
B. Kam. 114 b. Snh. 101 a. B. Bath. 80 a דּוּבְשָׁנָן their own stock of honey.
— Pl. דּוּבְשָׁנִין. Ḥall. I, 4 (
, expl. Y. ib. 57 d מלי גאלה meligala, honey and milk cake (Mish. ed. דובשין, corr. acc.).
Gitt. 69 a חלבניתא ד' sweet galbanum.
, v. דִּפְשְׁקָא
Part. דָאִיג, דָּיֵיג. Sabb. 156 b הוה דְאִיגָא וכ' she was very much troubled over it. M. Kat. 28 a הוו קא דַיְיגֵי רבנן the rabbis were troubled (over R. Huna’s sudden death).
, v. רוּנְגָּר

sense.definition: (דוג, v. דָּאַג) drippings from melting fat.
sense.notes: —בֵּי ד' a receptacle for the drippings of a roast. Ḥull. 111 b
, Yalk. Deut. 923, v. כדכיאות
, Y. Keth. II, 26 d, v. זוֹג

sense.definition: (= דגוגית, denom. of דָּג) fisher-boat, light-going boat for shallows, Palestinean word for Babylonian בִּיצִּית.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 73 a; 78 b; Y. ib. V, beg. 15 a

sense.definition: simile, illustration (cmp. מָשָׁל ל־, משל למה הדבר דומה).
sense.notes: Cant. R., introd. עד … היתה ד' up to Solomon’s days the method of argument by illustration was unknown (in Hebrew literature).

Y. Hor. III, beg. 47 a די' דידכו דמי וכ' (prob. to be read דמיא) your appearance resembles that of your Maker. Eduy. V, 6; Ber. 19 a ד' השקוה it was for show that they made her drink, i.e. they merely pretended to give her the real ‘bitter waters’; [oth. opin. they performed the act on one who was, like themselves, a descendant of gentiles; Y. M. Kat. III, 81 d דִּכְמָהּ השקוה, (a popular adaptation of our w.; v. דִּכְמָא), expl. דִּכְוָותָהּ something like it]. Midr. Sam. ch. XX (expl. תפקד לשלום, I Sam. XVII, 18) ד' דידהין how they look.

sense.definition: sample, example, token (corresp. to h. אוֹת).
sense.notes: Ḥag. 16 a (play on ד̇ג̇ול מ̇רבבה, Cant. V, 10) ד̇וג̇מ̇א הוא ברבבה שלו He is exemplified by His myriad (of angels), i.e. the Divine nature is recognized indirectly from the nature of His ministering messengers, v. Cant. R. to V, 9.—Keth. 28 b קחו לכם ד' וכ' take a warning example &c. Taan. 23 a ד' לדורות a sample (of great fertility) as a lesson for future generations. Sabb. 30 b I will show thee דּוּגְמָתָן וכ' (Ms. M. דּוּגְמָתוֹ) the like thereof in this world.—Ib. 11 b the dyer must not go out on the Sabbath בדו' שבצוארו (Ar. בדי' שבאזנו; Tosef. ib. I, 8 בדו' שבאזנו) with the sample of colors around his neck, v. אוֹת II.—Num. R. s. 6 (expl. Job XXXVI, 7 עיניו) ד' דידהו that which is like his own doing, i.e. some realization of his ideal, v. עֵינָא; Midr. Sam. ch. XXVIII דוגמה דידהון; Gen. R. s. 71 דוגמת דידיה (corr. acc.), v. next w.; a. fr.— Pl. דּוּגְמוֹת. B. Kam. 119 b, v. אוֹת II (Var. Ms. דּוּגְמָאוֹת). [Our w., owing to its phonetic resemblance to דִּכְמָא, is inflected as though it were a native, whence the forms: דּוּגְמָה, דּוּגְמת, דוּגְמָת־, דּוּגְמוֹת, and even a Var. to Tosef. Sabb. I, 8 דִּגְמוֹ, as though fr. דֶּגֶם.]

sense.definition: , (דיגמטורי) m. pl. (a transpos. of διαγράμματα; cmp. גִּימַטְרְיָא) plans, designs.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 11 מראה לאלו מעין ד' שלהן וכ' Ar. (ed. דוגמא גטורין, some ed. in one w., corr. acc.; Tanḥ. Ki Thissa 33 מעין דוגמא שלהם) He shows to these (the righteous) something corresponding to their designs (reward) and to those &c. Tanḥ. P’kudé 11 (ref. to Job XXXVI, 7) the Lord refuses not to the righteous man ד' שלו a realization of his designs (ideals), v. preced.
, Midr. Till. to Ps. CXVIII, read הֶגְמוֹנִיּוֹת, v. הֶגְמוֹנְיָה

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. David, King of Israel.
sense.notes: Ber. 4 a; a. v. fr.—בן ד' or ד' (= משיח) the son of David (the David of the future), the redeemer of Israel from captivity. Snh. 98 b ד' אחר a second David. R. Hash. 25 a (a secret watchword) ד' מלך וכ' David, the King of Israel, is alive &c. Y. Ber. II, 5 a top. Yeb. 62 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: friend, lover, beloved ; (allegor.) the Lord, as the beloved of Israel.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to I, 4, v. גִּנּוּן; a. e.

Sifra K’dosh. Par. 10, ch. XI; Yeb. 54 b.—Fem. דּוֹדָה, דֹּדָה aunt. Ib.— Pl. דּוֹדִים 1) friends, related. Y. Snh. XI, 30 a bot.; Y. Ber. I, 3 b bot. (ref. to Cant. I, 2) ד' דברי וכ' the words of the scholars are related to the words of the Law; Cant. R. to l. c. Ab. Zar. 35 a דברי דודים Ms. M. (ed. דודיך) the words of the friends (the scholars); Num. R. s. 14. Gen. R. s. 37 בני דוֹדֵיהֶן וכ' cousins (related nation).—2) (abstr. noun) friendship, love. Ab. Zar. II, 5 (29 b) do you read כי טובים דּוֹדֶיךָ מיין … דּוֹדַיִיךְ מיין Ms. M. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. a. Cant. R. l. c.) better is thy (God’s) love, or thy (Israel’s) love?

Gen. R. s. 37, beg. בני דוֹדֵיכֶן אנן we are your cousins (Yalk. Chr. 1073 דוֹדֵיכוֹן, pl.).— Pl. דּוֹדַיָּא. Y. Taan. IV, 69 a top כן ארתהון דבני ד' עבדין is this the way cousins act?; Lam. R. to II, 2 דדנייא (corr. acc.).

Targ. II Kings IV, 38; a. e.—Snh. 64 a, v. אֲבָרָא; a. fr.— Pl. דּוּדַיָּא, דּוּדֵי. Targ. Zach. XIV, 20; a. e.—Nidd. 68 a ד' תסרת thou wantest boilers (for hot water). B. Kam. 101 a top, v. כַּפְרָא. Sabb. 41 a, v. אַנְטִיכִי.—Fem. דּוּדְוָותָא, דַּדְוָו'. Targ. Y. Ex. XVI, 3; XXXVIII, 3; a. e. Targ. Y. Lev. VIII, 31 דּוֹדְוָותַיָּא (!).
, v. דּוּרַאי
, v. דִּידְבָא
, v. דּוֹד
, v. דּוּדָא
, v. דַּרְדּוּר
, v. דַּרְדַנְיָא

sense.definition: Dodanites, a Javanic tribe, v. דַּרְדַּנְיָיא.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 37, beg.; Yalk. Chr. 1073 (ref. to דֹּדָ', Gen. X, 4, a. רוֹדָ', I Chr. I, 7).
, v. דוי
Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 d bot.; v., however, זַכְרוּתָא.
m. = דְּהַן II. Targ. Prov. III, 8 ed. Lag. (ed. רוה', Ms. רַוְחָ', h. text שקוי).
, v. דַּהַנְיְתָא
, v. דּוֹבָא
, v. דַּוָאר
, v. דִּיוָודָא
, v. דְּוַי

sense.definition: (דול) bucket ; (collect.) irrigation by means of buckets.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. XL, 15 (ed. Vien. דּוּל).—Erub. 20 b דרי ליה לד' בהדיה he might carry the bucket with him.—B. Mets. 104 a top איבעי לך … בד' you ought to have brought the water over from the large well by irrigating works. Ib. 77 a מאן … לד' if one hired working men for irrigating work. M. Kat. 4 a הוה דלי ד' was doing irrigating work. Yeb. 97 b דלאי דדלו ד' ye water drawers engaged in irrigation.— Pl. דַּוְולִין. Targ. II Esth. I, 2.
, v. דַּוְלָלָא
m. = דַּאֲבוֹן. Ab. II, 7 Ar. (ed. דְּאָגָה).
, v. דָּאבוֹנָא
, v. דּוּר
, v. דַּוָּאר
Sabb. 81 b משום ד' because of treading down (injuring a neighbor’s field). B. Bath. 22 b ד' דהכא וכ' the passage between the walls (stamping the ground) is beneficial to both buildings.
B. Kam. 116 b דַוְושֵׁיה נקיט ואזיל he (the boatman) took his wonted course. Ber. 16 a דוושיה נקיט Ar. (ed. סרכיה) he followed his habit (in recitation).

sense.definition: (דוי) the sick man’s draught, medicine for the appetite.
sense.notes: Targ. Job VI, 7 (Ms. זוותא; h. text כדוי).

sense.definition: (= h. דָּוָה; v. דּוֹבָא) a menstruating woman.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XXXI, 23 (some ed. דְּוָתָא).
, v. רוּנְגָּר

sense.definition: , Hif. הֵדִיחַ (b. h.; v. דְּחַהּ) [ to brighten,] to wash off, cleanse, rinse.
sense.notes: Mikv. VII, 3. Ḥull. 8 b מֵדִיחַ he must wash the meat (at the place where the knife passed); a. fr.—Tam. IV, 2 בית המְדִיחִין the washers’ hall where the offering meat was washed.—Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 d bot. לָדִיחַ = לְהָדִיחַ.
Makhsh. IV, 3 בשביל שתּוּדַח in order that the dish may be washed by the rain; Ḥull. 16 a; Sabb. 11 b; a. fr.
Koh. R. to VII, 1; Midr. Sam. ch. XXIII.
אֲדִיחַ same. Targ. II Chr. IV, 6.
, Yeb. 80 b; Gitt. 57 a, v. דֵּיהָה
ch. = h. דּוֹחַן. Targ. Y. Num. XV, 19.
Targ. Job XXXIV, 7 (Lev. דַּהֲכָא).
Pes. 35 a. Ber. 37 a; a. fr.
Ḥag. 5 a בשעת דּוֹחֲקוֹ just when he needs it (no sooner); Yeb. 63 a (v. Tosaf. a. l.). Ab. II, 3 בשעת דָּחְקוֹ when he is in need (of official protection). Y. Ber. V, 9 b מד', v. אַזְכָּרָה.
[In later Hebr. דּוֹחַק a forced opinion or reply, v. next w.]

Targ. Y. Num. XXII, 24 בד' in a narrow place.—Pes. 14 b, a. e. מאי דּוֹחֲקֵיה דר' וכ' what forces R. … (logically) to put it &c.—Ḥull. 8 b ד' דסכינא the force of the knife (the blade forcing its way).
Ber. 6 a ד' דכלה Ms. M. (ed. ד' דהוה בכלה) the pushing at public lectures, v. כַּלָּה. Ib. b, v. אַגְרָא I.
Targ. Ex. III, 9; a. e.—Gitt. 45 a משום ד' דציבורא because the exorbitant price is an extortion of the community.
Bets. 30 a דדרו בד' (Ms. M. רהקא) a load carried (on ordinary days) with a great effort.

sense.definition: [ to drip, melt away,] to mourn, repine.
sense.notes: Nidd. 23 b (ref. to Deut. XXI, 17 אֹנוֹ, cmp. דְּוַי) מי שלבו דָוֶה עליו a child over whose death his (the father’s) heart is grieved. Ber. 16 b אל יִדְיֶה לבנו may our heart not sink. Kidd. 81 b יִדְווּ כל הדָּוִוים let all those mourn who feel the affliction; Naz. 23 a. Yeb. 47 a the Israelites … are דווים (some ed. דְּווּיִים, Part. pass.) broken down (under persecution). Gen. R. s. 60; s. 74; a. fr.
Pesik. Asser, p. 96 a על אותו האיש שנ' over this man (me) in his affliction; Tanḥ. R’eeh ed. Bub. 7 (Tanḥ. ib. 10 שנידוהו, Yalk. Deut. 892; Prov. 962 שנדוהו, corr. acc.).
Y. R. Hash. I, 57 b bot. מַדְוֶה לה וכ' afflicts it (the year, causes prayers and fasting from fear of failure of the crop) in its beginning.
Targ. Jer. XLVIII, 17; a. e.
Ḥull. 51 a מִידְּווּ וקיימי they groan constantly.

sense.definition: (v. preced; cmp. b. h. כָּסַף, כָּלָה) to look out for, espy.
sense.notes: Sabb. 35 a דָּוֵי למזרח Ar. (ed. דָּאוֵי) he looked eastward (for the reflection of the setting sun). Ib. 53 b they raise their nostrils [read:] ומסגי כי דָּוֵי (Ms. O. כדובי) and march like looking out (for the wolf). Ker. 6 a דְּווּ לפומיה וכ' Ar. (ed. חזו) watch the lips of &c. Tam. 26 b דוי להכא וכ' he (the watchman) looks out in both directions.
Targ. I Kings XX, 43; XXI, 4 (ed. Vien. דַּוָי).— Pl. דָּוָן, דָּוָון. Targ. Is. XVI, 7 (ed. Lag. הו', corr. acc.); 11.

sense.definition: (= h. דְּוַי, v. preced.) grief, affliction.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXXV, 18 (h. text אוֹנִי, v. דָּוָה). Targ. Y. ib. XLII, 38 דָּווֹי (O. דוונא).
m. same. Snh. 100 b (cit. fr. the Book of Ben Sira) לא תעיל ד' וכ' suffer not grief to enter thy heart &c.; v. גִּיבַּר
, v. דּוֹבָא
Yalk. Jer. 279 דּוְיוֹנוֹ של בית the grief over the (destroyed) Temple (differ. in Lam. R. introd. 32).

sense.definition: (דּוּל Af.) winding; clue, only in דויל ידיה the clue which one’s own hand wound up, i.e. one’s own doing.
sense.notes: Pes. 28 a, v. גִּירָאָה. Cmp. דְּלִיל.
Y. Bets. I, 60 d top ויָדוֹךְ וכ' but why should he not pound a day before?—Part. pass. דָּךְ, v. דַּךְ.

sense.definition: to designate, mark off, v. דּוּךְ II. [Gen.
sense.notes: R. s. 5, v. דּוּךְ III.]

Bets. I, 7 נִדּוֹכִין כדרכן are pounded (on Holy Days) in their usual way. Ib. 14 a לָדוֹכָהּ וכ' as to pounding it (salt) alone. Yoma 75 a דבר שנ' וכ' something which is pounded in the mortar (spices); a. fr.
מְדוּכָּךְ crushed. Yalk. Ps. 848 מְדוּכָּכִים אנו we are crushed (Gen. R. s. 5 מדוכנין, v. דָּכַן).
Part. דָּאִיךְ, דָּאֵיךְ. Targ. O. Num. XI, 8. Bets. 14 a דּוֹךְ, v. infra.
same. Bets. 14 a כי דַיְיכַת וכ' ed. (Ms. M. דייקת … דוק) when thou poundest (on a Holy Day), bend the mortar sideways and pound.
Kidd. 81 a אתו כ"ע לַאֲדוּכֵיה Ar. s. v. אדך (missing in ed.) people came to put the fire out.

דכי to muster, Schr. KAT p. 209 9) [ marked off, pointed out,] place, stand, hall. Targ. I Kings XIV, 28 (ed. Lag. דובא, some ed. רובא, corr. acc.); Targ. II Chr. XII, 11 (h. text תָּא).—Ber. 18 b. Ib. 42 b. V. דּוּכְתָּא.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) leader, chief commander, only in דּוּךְ דּוּכָנִין (an adaptation of dux ducum, δώξ δωκῶν, v. Du Cange s. v.) the leader of the services of the Levites, v. דּוּכָן.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. X, 12 c; Num. R. s. 7 (rendering of נשיא נשיאי Num. III, 32). Ib. s. 4, end [read:] אלעזר היה דוך דוכנין וכ' Eleazar was chief commander, prince over princes; cmp. דּוּכּוֹס.—* Pl. דּוּכִים. Gen. R. s. 5 (play on ד̇כ̇י̇ם̇, Ps. XCIII, 3) (‘the rivers lift up their voices’, saying to the waves of the Sea) דֹּוּכִֹיֹםֹ קבלונו ye leaders, receive us; [Yalk. Ps. 848 דַּכִּים אנו we are crushed].
, v. דּוּךְ II

Ex. R. s. 15; a. fr.—[Gen. R. s. 5 לדוכוס ים Rashi, v. דכסס.]— Pl. דּוּכְסִים, דּוּכּוֹסִין. Cant. R. to II, 15 עשו ודוּכְסֶיהָ (read רומי) Rome and her duces. Gen. R. s. 78 דּוּכְסַי my (Rome’s) duces ; a. fr. [Lev. R. s. 16 דוכוסיא רואני, read as ed. Wil. דוכוס אחד ר'.] V. דּוּכְסָא.
, v. preced.
Targ. Y. I Num. XI, 8.

sense.definition: (cmp. דּוּךְ II) place to stand on, stand, stage, esp. Dukhan, the priests’stage from which they pronounce the benediction.
sense.notes: Midd. II, 6; a. fr.—עלה לד' to go up the stage, to officiate as priest. Sabb. 118 b; a. e.—2) religious service from the stand, the Levite’s singing, teaching. Meg. 3 a; Arakh. 4 a the Levites מִדּוּכָנָן Ms. M. (ed. בר') must interrupt their services.— Pl. דּוּכָנִים, דּוּכָנִין, v. דּוּךְ III. Cmp. דָּכוֹן.

Targ. Y. Num. VI, 23. Targ. Ezek. XLII, 12 (h. גדרת); a. e.—In gen. teacher’s platform, pulpit. B. Bath. 21 a ריש ד' superintendent of the platform, title of a tutor who assists the teacher of a primary class numbering more than twenty five pupils.—Cmp. דִּכְוָון.
Y. M. Kat. I, 80 d bot. buy for us שיחורין לד' peas for pounding.

Lam. R. to I, 5. Ab. Zar. 11 a; a. e.— Pl. דּוּכְסִין, דּוּכְסַיָּיא. Targ. Cant. VI, 8; a. e.—Gen. R. s. 67; a. fr.—Koh. R. to X, 18; Lam. R. introd. (R. Alex. 2) (ref to Is. XXII, 8 מסך) [read:] גלי דֻּכְסַיֵּיה He uncovered (disgraced) its (the Temple’s) commanders (cmp. דּוּךְ III).
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (transpos. of δύσχιστος) hard to split, an inferior kind of parchment, opp. to קלף, a split parchment of superior quality.
sense.notes: Men. 31 b. Ib. 32 b sq.; Sabb. 79 b; a. fr.— Pl. דּוּכְסוּסְטִין. Y. Sabb. VIII, 11 b (not טון …).

sense.definition: (v. דּוּךְ III, a. סוּסְיָא; a popular adaptation of טַכְסְיוֹטָא, ταξεώτης) the magistrate’s officer, sergeant.
sense.notes: Meg. 27 a דוכסו' ed. (Ms. M. דוכסס', Ar. דכסס'), expl. by R. Shesheth פרשא דמתא the riding messenger of the town. [Cmp. דורקטי.]
Cant. R. to VI, 12 [read:] הב לי ד' דגובבתא give me the governorship of G. (v. גּוֹבַבְתָּא). Ib. כד נסב ד' וכ' having entered the office he came down from there (to Sepphoris).
, Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c bot. בד', some ed., v. פְּרַכְסִין
, v. דִּכְסֵס
, v. דּוּכְסוּסְיָא
, v. דְּכַר II
, v. דָּכְרָן
Keth. 11 a, v. אַיְלֹונִית.
Ber. 42 b (interch. with דּוּךְ). Ib. 4 b בכל ד' everywhere else (in Rabbinical writings). Yeb. 62 a בד' אחריתי in another place (of the Scriptures). B. Mets. 93 b bot.; a. v. fr.
Denom. דְּוַל, דַּוְולָא.

sense.definition: to wind up, make skeins, prepare for spinning.
sense.notes: Yeb. 63 a זבון ולא תדויל Ar. s. v. דל 5 buy (ready-made) and do not wind skeins (ed. זבין ולא תיזול, v. זוּל I a. II).

sense.definition: to be drawn from, to give water enough for irrigation.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 8 a ודילמא לא מִידְּוִול but perhaps the well (to be dug) will prove unfit for irrigation? Ib. 12 b
, v. דְּוול
, v. דְּלוּב
, v, דְלִפְקִי.
— Pl. דַּוְלָלֵי. Ḥull. 60 a they give the leper a reel וסתר דַּוְלָלֵי ed. (Ar. דווללא) and he must wind up the clues or skeins.
(δελφίν) dolphins (a fish about which many fables were circulated among the ancients, cmp. Sm. Ant. s. v.). Bekh. 8 a דולפנ' (Var. דּוּלְפִינָא, corr. acc.; Ar. ed. pr. דִּילְ'); Tosef. ib. I, 11.
— Pl. דּוֹלְפָנֵי. Keth. 60 b. [דולפנין, Bekh. 8 a, v. preced.] [דולפני, Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. I, 9, read דולפקי.]
, v. דְּלִפְקִי
, Sifré Deut. 231, v. לִיבְדְּקוֹס
, v. דְּרַרְיָא
, imper. of דָּמַם.

sense.definition: (cmp. דמם, דבב) to speak in a low voice, to suspect.
sense.notes: Part. pass. דָּיִים suspected. Yeb. 52 a מֵידַם הוה דָ' מחימתיה he was suspected of illicit relations with his mother-in-law; Kidd. 12 b דַיְימָא חמתיה מיניה … (v. Rashi to Yeb. l. c.) his mother-in-law was suspected &c.; Yeb. 69 b sq.
Tosef. Par. II (I), 1 וד' היתה נקראת the cow was named Duma (Var. וד' שמו the owner’s name was D., v. דָּמָא); Yalk. Num. 759 דמת.—V. דּוּמָה II.
Nidd. 66 a, v. דִּימָה.
Sot. 27 a. Gitt. 69 b דשדתיה ד' בת ד' which an ill reputed daughter of an ill-reputed mother has spun.
Masc. Dumah, the guardian angel of the deceased. Ber. 18 b (Ms. M. דּוּמָא). Ḥag. 5 a משלימנא ליה לד' I (the angel of death) hand him over to Dumah. Sabb. 152 b
, v. דִּימוֹס
, v. דִּימוֹסִין
M. Kat. 18 b; Yeb. 25 a ד' דמתא וכ' the gossip of a place must remain undenied for a day and a half (in order to be acted upon legally).

sense.definition: (דְּמָא) resemblance, ( there is) an analogy; ( under) analogous conditions.
sense.notes: Kidd. 19 a בנו ד' דידיה וכ' ‘his son’ (Ex. XXI, 9) means a son like himself (the father), as he (the father) is of age, so must his son (to whom he designates her) be of age. Shebu. 40 b; B. Mets. 4 b ד' דכלים וכ' under similar conditions as the just stated claim of chattel and landed property. Meg. 2 a זמניהם ד' דזמנם מה וכ' z’mannehem (their respective seasons, Esth. IX, 3

sense.definition: is analogous to z’mannam (ib. 27); as z’mannam means two days &c.—M.
sense.notes: Kat. 4 a; a. fr.
Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 d ברתיה דדמיטי'; Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 d דתימטיניס (corr. acc.).
, Esth. R. to VI, 10 ד' פנטון, read קוֹמִיס פְרִיבָטוֹן, v. בגרון. V. קוֹמִיס.

sense.definition: , read דּוֹמִינֵי (vocat. of dominus) O Lord.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to I, 5 Ar., v. בִּיבֵי. [דומינו, דומינון, דומינין, Gen. R. s. 8; Koh. R. to VI, 10, read הִימְנוֹן.]

(dominicae, sub aedes, v. Revue des Etudes Juives, 1884, p. 277) churches. Snh. 74 b הני קווקי וד' היכי יהבינן להו נורא Ms. M. (ed. omit. נורא; Var. lect., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) how dare we give fire to those churches (on Sundays)? [קווקי, קוואקי &c., misnomer of κυριακή, the name used by the Greek teachers of Christianity, corresp. to the Latin dominica.—For another explan. v. Revue des Etudes Juives 1885, p. 195 sq.]
, v. דַּמְכָא
, v. דָּמָם
, v. דּוֹמִינְקֵי
, v. דִּימוֹסְיָא
, Yeb. 17 a, v. רומקי
, v. דִּין
B. Bath. 90 b they called it ד' פפא (quot. Tosaf. to Yeb. 79 a ed. רוז, Ms. M. רז, Ms. H. כּוּז) and they named it (the measure introduced by Papa) ד' פפא Papa’s keg
, v. דְּוָון
Gen. R. s. 10, end (בה …, corr. acc.); Yalk. ib. 16 דונאט'. Ex. R. s. 41 דונה טיבה some ed. (corr. acc.). Num. R. s. 7; a. fr.
, v. דַּנְבָא
, v. דִּינָג
Lam. R. to I, 4 נעשו כד' they became (yellow-complected) like wax.
, v. רוּנְגָּר
, v. דּוֹנָאטִיבָא

sense.definition: (prob. an abbrev. of Dositheus, v. דוֹסְתַּאי) Dosa, a Tannai, usu. named R. D.
sense.notes: ben Harkhinas, or Hork’nos. Eduy. III, 1.—Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. IV, 14; a. fr.—Erub. 83 a [read:] ר' נתן אומר ר' ד' אומר (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). [Y. Shek. VII, 50 d ר' ד', Men. 50 b ר' יוסי.] V. חְנִינָא, a. הַרְכִּינָס.
, v. דּוֹסְתַּאי
, Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 3, v. דִּיסַקְיָא
, Tanḥ. Noah 1, v. דּוּרְמַסְקִית

a disciple of Shammai. Orlah II, 5.—2) D. father of Abba José. Tosef. Peah IV, 2 ed. Zuck. (Var. דוסאי); Yoma 22 b; a. fr.—3) R. D. son of R. Judah. Tosef. Shebi. II, 18; a. e.—4) R. D. son of R. Jannai. Tosef. Ber. VII. (VI), 8. Nidd. 31 b; a. fr.
Gen. R. s. 18 (among gentiles) the wife may divorce him והיא נותנה לו ד' and she gives him the repudium (v. Sm. Ant. s. v.).

sense.definition: , דָּפִי; r. דָּפָה to strike against, damage; cmp. דפן) damage to reputation (cmp. meanig of גָּדַף), taint, reproach.
sense.notes: Yoma 22 b לא היה בו שום ד' no reproach rested on Saul’s descent. Tem. 15 b; Tosef. B. Kam. VIII, 13; a. fr.—Snh. 99 b הגדות של ד'; v. דָּרַשׁ.—Pes. 30 b earthen ware אינו יוצא מידי דוֹפְיוֹ לעולם (Ms. O. מדפנו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 50; Ab. Zar. 34 a דופנו, Ms. M. דָּפְיוֹ) can never get rid of its defect (once made unclean, it cannot be cleansed by any process, v. תַּקָּנָה).
Targ. Ps. L, 20 (Var. דּוֹפִי, דָּפְיָא, Regia דָּפְיוּ fem.).
, v. דיפלומט'
, v. דיפלון
Ab. Zar. 34 a, v. דּוֹפִי.

sense.definition: board-partition, esp. a wall of the festive booth (סוּכָּה).
sense.notes: Succ. 4 a ד' האמצעי the middle of the three walls. Ib. ד' עקומה the curved wall, a legal fiction by which a part of the ceiling may be considered as part of a curved wall.—Ib. 6 b; a. fr.
to bottom, rim &c. Ohol. IX, 16 תחת דָּפְנָהּ under the belly of its side; Tosef. ib. X, 9 דּוֹפְנָהּ. Ib. VII, 10 side of a cave, opp. to שקוף &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: the chest surrounding the lungs, ribs, also a single rib.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 48 a, a. fr. ריאה הסמוכה לד' lungs adhering to the chest. Snh. 49 a ד' חמישית the fifth rib (counting from the lowest).

יוצא ד' a fetus extracted by means of the cesarean section. Nidd. V, 1; a. fr.—Metaph. תלה בד' to suspend from the wall, i.e. to leave a decision in suspense. Y. Kidd. IV, 65 b bot.; Y. Snh. VI, 23 c bot. בריפן (corr. acc.).— Pl. דּוֹפַנִּים, constr. דּוֹפַנֵּי; mostly דְּפַנּוֹת. Ḥull. 45 b דופני ריאה the grooves between the lungs, דפנות ribs. Ib. a שתי ד' two sides of the chest.—Succ. I, 1; a. fr.—Tosef. Ohol. VI, 2 בצד דּוֹפְנִי וכ' ed. Zuck. on the wall-like side of the tent. Ib. עם דופני של אוהל, ed. Zuck., read (with R. S. to Ohol. V, 7) רפנות or (with ed.) דּוֹפְנוֹ.
B. Mets. 23 b אי דדפנ' Ar. (ed. דפקא) whether the piece is from the ribs.— Pl. דּוֹפַנְיָיתָא. Targ. Y. Lev. XXIII, 42 (דּוֹפַנְיָיהָא).—דָּפְנָתָא. Y. Succ. I, 51 d
, v. דּוֹפָן

sense.definition: (דפק; cmp. אַגָּף) that against which a turning body knocks, frame, esp .
sense.notes: dofek, the frame supporting the movable stone of a tomb, v. גּוֹלֵל. Ohol. II, 4; a. e.— Pl. דּוֹפְקִין. Ib. דופק ד' the frame supporting the frame stones or sills.
Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 16; 18.

sense.definition: (דפק) knockers, name of a parasite plant growing on thorns, cmp. כָּשׁוּת.
sense.notes: Tosef. Erub. XI (VIII), 11 קרנין וד' (Var. קוצין) ‘horns’ and ‘knockers’.
, v. דִּיפְרָא
, v. דִּפְשְׂקָא

sense.definition: (b. h.) to skip, dance; to rejoice.
sense.notes: Denom. דִּיצָה.

Targ. Job XLI, 14 תדיץ ed. Lag. (Ms. תדוץ, some ed. תדיף, corr. acc.).—Targ. II Sam. I, 20. Targ. Ps. XXI, 14 (ed. Lag. נְדוֹצְצָא Pol.); a. fr.— Part. דָּאִיץ, דָּיֵיץ. Targ. Hab. I, 15. Targ. Prov. XXIX, 6; a. e.

sense.definition: (contr. of דְּעַץ) to prick, stick, squeeze.
sense.notes: Sabb. 50 b דָּצָהּ שלפה וכ' if he stuck it in, pulled it out &c.—Ib. 156 b דָּצְתָהּ בגודא (Ms. O. דעיצתא בביזעא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 30) she stuck it (the brooch) into the wall. Ḥull. 93 b אי דָץ ביה מידי if he stuck something into the nostrils (so as to keep them open). Succ. 37 b לא לֵדוּץ וכ' one must not squeeze the palm branch between the myrtle and willow (after they have been tied together). [B. Bath. 74 a דצייה Ar., v. דְּעַץ.]

sense.definition: a withered spot in the eye, v. דַּק II.

sense.notes: Bets. 14 a, v. דּיּךְ.—Part. Peil דָּיִיק powdered. Ib. b ד' טפי fine-powdered. Ḥull. 51 b, v. כִּיתְנָא, V. דְּקַק.

sense.definition: (cmp. בִּין, בָּקַר a. oth.) to examine carefully, to be particular, exact in expression; to pay special attention, to mind.
sense.notes: Ib. 6 a, a. fr. דָּק ואשכח he examined and found. Succ. 8 a לא דק he did not express himself exactly; a. fr.— Part. דָּיֵיק careful. Keth. 18 b מֵידַק ד' he is very careful (as to what witnesses he uses). Yoma 83 b הווה ד' בשמא minded a man’s name (considering it an indication of his character). Ib. לא הוו דַיְיקֵי בשמא did not mind &c. Ib. דַּיְיקִיתוּ ye mind.—Part. Peil דָּיִיק (v. Pa.) proved, conclusive. B. Kam. 3 b those verses לא כמר דָּיְיקֵי וכ' are no evidence either for the one or the other.—Denom. דֵּיקָא, דְּיוּקָא, דּוְקָא.
Sabb. 155 a bot. דדֵיְּיקָה ואכלה Ms. M. (ed. דדיקה באוכלא) she grinds her food carefully.

sense.definition: to argue by pressing a word, to analyze, prove.
sense.notes: Keth. 31 b ד' מרישא takes his argument from the first clause; a. fr.
Targ. Y. Lev. XXVII, 18. Ib. XXV, 50, v. דִּקְדֵק; a. e.

Koh. R. to III, 9 א' מלכא the king was irritated. Pesik. B’shall. p. 86 b; Yalk. Sam. 152 אוֹדִיקַת סרח וכ' Serah … grew angry ; cmp. דִּקְדֵּק.—2) to examine, look with anxiety, wait attentively. Targ. Prov. VII, 6. Targ. Ps. XIV, 2; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 17 אודיק … לקלהון R. … examined into the noise they made; Lev. R. s. 34; Yalk. Lev. 665; Yalk. Is. 352. Y. Keth. XII, 35 a top; Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top א' לון תכ' Bar K. looked out for them (waiting for them to ask him).
Nez. 7 b נחית לד' enters into minuteness (saying ‘one and a half’).

Yeb. 76 a ד' שערתא a real barley corn it must be (nothing else). Men. 30 a באמצע שיטה ד' only in the middle of a line.—Gitt. 44 a ד' או לאו ד' is this meant exactly (one hundred), or not exactly? Men. 27 b אל ד' el (towards) is meant in its exact sense; a. fr.
Targ. Is. XL, 15. Ib. XXVIII, 28.

sense.definition: = h. דַּק, a withered spot in the eye (or withered in growth, dwarf).
sense.notes: Targ. O. Lev. XXI, 20 (Y. II ib. נניס).
Keth . 31 b בד' דהא וכ' they differ as to the conclusion to be drawn from this Mishnah. Zeb. 31 b (Rashi: דְּיוּקָא).

sense.definition: (δόκια, pl. of δόκιον) beams of the ceiling.
sense.notes: Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד בר נש, an oneirocritical interpret. of Kappadokia) Kappa in Greek is twenty, ד' בל"י קורות (not דיקיא) dokia in Greek is beams; v. דִּיקָא.
, v. דִּיקְלִיטְיָינוֹס

sense.definition: (v. דּוּק) pr. n. pl. Dukim (cmp. צוֹפִים), Dokos, a stronghold near Jericho.
sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c טקסיס דד' the garrison of D.
Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 b (Bab. ib. 6 b מינאה).
, v. דִּיקְלִיטְ'

Ab. Zar. 10 a ספרא ד' an accurate scribe (paying attention to exact historical dates).— Pl. דַּוְקָנֵי, דַּוְו'. Men. 29 b ספרי ד' careful copyists of the Bible. Yeb. 43 a משום דמסיימי בה ד' זו וכ' because exact scholars report a traditional addition (to the Halachah in question), ‘These are the words of R. S.’

sense.definition: (denom. of דְּקַן; adopted in Hebr.) trimming shears on a pole.
sense.notes: Y. Maasr. III, end, 51 a היתה ניטלת בד' if the fruit is taken off with trimming shears (by a person standing outside the garden). Ib. צור צור דּוּקְנִיתָךְ וכ' wrap well up (keep well thy question about) the pruner (sophistical as it is), it is better than anything (the Agadists have to say).—Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 9 האיזמל של די' one knife of the shears.
, v. preced.

sense.definition: (דקר) fork-like reed, opp. to קני plain stems; prop. Pl. דּוּקְרִין, דּוּקְרֵי.
sense.notes: Succ. 13 a ד' דקני the pronged reeds (corresp. to אַפְקוֹתָא of the palm-tree, Rashi). Lev. R. s. 12.

Y. Erub. I, 18 c קנה וד' reed-stem and prongs. Ib. 19 c כמין דק'; Y. Kil. IV, 29 b כמין דוק'; Y. Succ. I, 52 a bot. כמין דְּקָרִים (v. דֶּקֶר). Y. Shebi. II, 33 d top עושה לה דיק' (corr. acc.) he puts under it a pronged prop. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 14 הדוק' ed. Zuck. (Var. דורקין).— Pl. דּוֹקְרָנִים, דּוֹקְרָנִין, דָּק'. Y. Kil. l. c. he took דוק' וסותם forked reeds with which he closed the breach; Y. Erub. I, 19 c top; Y. Succ. l. c.—Tosef. ib. I, 4 if one made a ceiling of the Succah בקנים ובד' with (plain) reeds and with forked reeds; Bab. ib. 13 a קנים וד' (Ms. M. 2 קנים הד', v. Ar. s. v. דקר), expl. קנים של ד' pronged reeds. Tosef. Men. XI, 6 דומין לדק' shaped like forks; Men. XI, 6 (96 a) מפוצלין … כמין ד' Ar. (ed. omit. כמין ד').—*Denom. מְדוּקְרָן fork-shaped. Tosef. Kil. IV, 5 קנים מְדוּקְרָנִים; Erub. 16 a; 11 b קנים הדוקרנין (Ms. M. הדוקרים).
— Pl. דּוֹקְרָנִין, דַּקְ'. Y. Yoma III, beg. 40 b כמין תרין דק' וכ' like two prongs of light; Y. Ber. I, 2 c דקור' (corr. דוקר'); Gen. R. s. 50 Ar. (ed. תרתין קרנין).

sense.definition: to form a circle or enclosure (v. Fl. to Levy Talm. Dict. I, p. 440 a sq.
sense.notes: ).—Denom. דּוּר II, דּוֹר, דִּירָה &c.].

Ber. 8 a לעולם יָדוֹר וכ' one must try to live in the same place with his teacher. Keth. 72 a; a. fr. אין אדם דָּר וכ', v. כְּפִיפָה. Ib. 110 b בל הדָּר בא"י whoever lives in Palestine.—Succ. 35 a (ref. to hadar, Lev. XXIII, 40) א"ת הָדָר אלא הַדָּר דבר שֶדָּר וכ' ed. (Ms. M. הָדָר דבר הַדָּר וכ') read not hadar but haddar, something which remains on its tree from year to year (without withering); a. fr.

sense.definition: to cause a circuit; ד' שדה to let cattle change folds within a field, to collect manure in a field, by letting cattle live on it.
sense.notes: Shebi. III, 4. Y. ib. 34 c bot. מְדַיְּירִין בטובה you may let your cattle live on one’s field as a favor; a. e.

Pesik. R. s. 3, beg. (play on דָּֽ֗רְ֗בָ֗ן֗) שמֵדִ֗יר̇ ב̇ינ̇ה בפרה it (the goad) causes understanding to dwell in the cow; Pesik Bahòod. p. 153 a שמורה (ed. O. שמדיר); Koh. R. to XII, 11 [read:] שהוא מְדַיֵּיר; Num. R. s. 14 שדָּר; Y. Snh. Tanḥ. B’haãl 15 דָּר אצל הפרה וכ'.—[Num. R. l. c. the words of the wise דָּ֗רִ֗ים ב̇ינ̇ה וכ' lodge understanding with men.]

sense.definition: to be manured by cattle living in folds, v. Piel.
sense.notes: Shebi. IV, 2; M. Kat. 13 a; a. e.

Targ. Ps. CV, 23; a. fr.—Pes. 113 a top (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6).—Part. דָּאִיר, דָּיֵיר. Targ. Ps. LVII, 5 דָיְירָא Ms. (ed. חיירא).—Yeb. 52 a דאיר בבי וכ' he resides with his father-in-law. B. Mets. 117 a דהוו דָיְירֵי who occupied. Taan. 24 a דָּיִירְנָא וכ' I live in a poor village.

sense.definition: to go around, to peddle (cmp. h. סָחַר).
sense.notes: R. Hash. 9 b (expl. דְּרוֹר, Lev. XXV, 10) כמְדַיֵּיר דיירא ומוביל וכ' Ms. M. (ed. בי דיירא, Ar. s. v. דר 3: כי מדַוַּאר דריא) as a traveller is licensed to go around and carry his goods through the whole district.

sense.definition: to deposit manure, v. preced. Pi.
sense.notes: —B. Kam. 113 b הני דדַיְּירֵי דירי Rashi (ed. דרי, Ms. R. דמְדַיְּירֵי דיירי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) those (gentiles) who manure fields for pay by letting cattle live on them in folds.

sense.definition: to place around ( in a row, Rashi).
sense.notes: Kidd. 81 a ד' גולפי placed jugs around (as a partition).—

sense.definition: to round a person, to overtake.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 92 b; B. Mets. 107 b (prov.) רהוט … ולא דַּוְּורוּהוּ וכ' Ar. (ed. מטו, אמטו) runners run but overtake not one who has taken a morning meal.
Kel. XVI, 3.— Pl. דּוּרִים. Ib.
Lam. R. to I, 1 רבתי (חד כות' 2), v. אֵדֶר I. [Y. Snh. X, 28 a top; Num. R. s. 14; 15; Tanḥ. B’haãl. 15, v. כַּדּוּר.]

sense.definition: [ circle, period, cmp. גִּיל] generation, contemporaries.
sense.notes: Arakh. 17 a ד' לפי פרנס as the leader so the generation; a. v. fr.—ד' הפלגה the generation which witnessed the separation of races; ד' המבול which perished in the flood; ד' המדבר which perished in the desert, &c. Snh. X, 3 (107 b, sq.); a. fr.— Pl. דּוֹרוֹת. Ib. 99 a; a. fr.—לַדּוֹרוֹת for all time to come; permanent, opp. לשעה, הוראת שעה a temporary ordinance. Ib. 16 b (ref. to Num. VII,

אותם במשיחה ולא לד' וכ' only they were installed with ointment, but not as a precedent for future installations; a. fr.—Men. 19 b, a. e. ד' משעה לא ילפינן a permanent law cannot be derived from a special temporary legislation.—פסח ד' annual Passover celebration, opp. to פסח מצרים the one observed in Epypt. Pes. IX, 5; a. fr.
imperat. of נָדַר. Kidd. 41 a; a. fr.

( v. דּוּר I) district, settlement, village (corresp. to h. חָצֵר). B. Bath. 54 b ד' דרעוותא Ms. M. (ed. דרעואתא); Erub. 12 a דּוּרָה דרעותא Shephardville (v., however, Berl. Beitr. z. Geogr. Babyl. p. 30).—Pes. 40 a ד' דבי וכ' the settlement of Be-Ḥashu.— Pl. דּוּרָתַיָּא. Targ. Ps. X, 8 ed. Lag. (Var. דרתיא, v. דַּרְתָּא; Ms. דּוּרָאתָיָיא).

sense.definition: , v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) dura, name of a jewel, mother of pearl(?).
sense.notes: Targ. Esth. I, 6 ד' דכרכי וכ' the dura of the Sea places.—Esth. R. to l. c. אית אתר … למרגליתא דּוּרָה there is a place where a pearl (or jewel) is called durah; Meg. 12 a there is a precious stone in the Sea places ודִירָה שמה Ms. M. (ed. דָּרָה) whose name is dirah ( darah); Y. Snh. X, 28 a top תמן קריין … דירה there (at a certain place) they call &c.

sense.definition: (דּוּר I) a parasite worm in the bowels.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 7 [read:] שאהיה נותן ד' במעיהן; v. דְּרַרְיָא.
B. Kam. 92 b (prov.) אי דלית ד' וכ' (our w. missing in Ar. s. v. דלא) if thou wilt lift the burden, I shall lift (if you will share the responsibility, I shall take the lead).

sense.definition: , or דַּוָּרָא, בֵּי ך' (cmp. דַּוָּאר I) Be-Dura ( Davvara), a station near Hagronia.
sense.notes: Ber. 31 a ed. (Ms. M. דיירא, without בי; Ms. F. בי דירא; oth. var. דראי, דרא, בי דודא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
pl. of δῶρον, v. LXX, II Chr. XXXII, 23 ed. R.) gifts. Y’lamd. to Num. XV, 1 quot. in Ar. s. v. דריה.

sense.definition: (v. דּוּרָא) county governor,—מרי ד' (Mylord, the governor), title of an officer.
sense.notes: Yoma 82 b; Snh. 74 a; Pes. 25 b (Ms. M. דודאי; Rashi: the lord of my village, v. דּוּרָא I).

of דבר, v. דַּבָּר; emp. רוֹרְבָּנָא a. דָּֽרְבָן) a haughty leader. Targ. Job XXXIV, 20 ed. Lag. (ed. Vien. דּוּרְבָּנֵי).— Pl. דּוּרְבָּנַיָּא, דּוּרְבָּנֵי. Ib. XXXV, 9 (Var. רַבְרְבָנַ'). Targ. Prov. VIII, 16 Var. ed. Lag. דוכרני (corr. acc.). Targ. Ps. XXXI, 24.

Y. Hor. III, beg. 47 a הוא וכל דו' דידיה Himself and His entire staff (of angels); Y. Snh. II, 20 a top דר'. Ex. R. s. 1 היה מניח דר' שלו he (Moses) left his escort.—Y’lamd. to Num. XII, 1, quot. in Ar. דרוגין. Num. R. s. 4 שיהיו עושין דר' לפניו that they should form a hierarchy of officers before him. Y. Keth. XII, 35 a bot. חמא דורגין דידיה וכ'; Koh. R. to IX, 10 דרגין (corr. acc.) he saw his (R. Ḥiya’s) suite in the future world, and his eyes became dim.

sense.definition: (Pers. durd, cmp., however, דרד) sediment, lees, dregs.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 32 a.— Pl. דּוּרְדַּיָּא, דּוּרְדֵּי (used as sing.). Targ. Ps. LXXV, 9—Meg. 12 b like wine resting על דּוּרְדַּיֵּיה upon its lees (Jer. XLVIII, 11). Ab. Zar. 34 a; a. e.
, v. דַּרְדּנְיָיא
, v. דַּרְדֵּס
Ab. Zar. 17 a El. ben D. (Var. דרודיא).
, v. דּוּרָא I, II.

sense.definition: , כרם ד' the vineyard of Doron.
sense.notes: Y. Kil. VII, 20 a bot.

sense.definition: , ch. form דּוֹרוֹנָא m. (δῶρον) present, honorary gift.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CXLI, 2. Ib. XL, 7; a. e.—Zeb. 7 b עולה ד' הוא the burnt offering is a votive gift (not a means of atonement). Pes. 118 b; a. fr.— Pl. דּוֹרוֹנִין. Targ. Y. Ex. XII, 46; a. e.—דּוֹרוֹנוֹת. Gen. R. s. 79. (Yalk. ib. 133 דּוֹרָנוֹת); a. fr.—Chald. form. דּוֹרוֹנְיָתָא. Targ. Ps. XX, 4 ed. Lag. (Ms. a. some ed. דוכר' incorr.). Cant. R. to VIII, 11 דורוניות, v. next w.
. Gen. R. s. 85, end, the one sent (to Babylon) dates, and the other (to Palestine) דוריות gifts of honor (purple cloak, ref. to Josh. VII, 2
; Cant. R. to VIII, 11 דורוניות (corr. acc. or דּוֹרוֹנוֹת).—Ex. R. s. 5 דוראות של עטרות gifts consisting of crowns.

sense.definition: (דור, דרר, v. דְּרוֹר) freedom, remission of tribute or fine, pardon.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 53 (play on י̇צ̇ח̇ק̇) [read:] י̇צ̇א ח̇וק̇ לעולם ליתן דו' לעולם a law was issued to give a grant (remission of sin) &c.; Yalk. ib. 92 יצא חוק דרור' וכ'. Gen. R. l. c. [read:] מה עשייה … ליתן ד' לעולם אף עשייה … ליתן ד' לעולם as the verb עשה used there (Esth. II, 18) means to grant a remission to the world, so does the verb עשה (Gen. XXI, 8) etc.; Pesik. Sos, p. 146 a דורניא (corr. acc.); Yalk. Gen. 93 דרור'.—Y’lamd. to Lev. XXI, 10, quot. in Ar. ד' שלימה full pardon.
, v. דּוֹרְיָא
, v. דּוֹרִיָּה
Targ. Y. II Deut. XXV, 4 דּוֹרְכֵיה (Y. I דָּרְכֵיה, h. text דיש).
Tosef. Maas. Sh. I, 10 ד' של תמרה ed. Zuck. (Var. ריתכאות).

sense.definition: (a disguise of Ἕρμης, or Mercurius, the divinity of commerce to whom a great annual fair, prob. of Tyre, was dedicated, v. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 d top, quot.
sense.notes: s. v. ארקליס) Durmos, name of a great annual fair. B. Mets. 72 b (Ms. M. אסרטיון, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
, v. דּוּרְמַסְקִית
, v. דרומילוס
, v. אנדרולומוסיא
, v. דַּרְמַסְקִינָא

Sifré Deut. 1 R. José ben D.; Ḥag. 3 b; Tosef. Yad. II, 16 דורמוס'; Tosef. Sot. III, 9; a. fr.—Mekh. Yithro, Baḥod. 1 Abba José b. D.—[Tanḥ. Noah 1 דוסמקא, דוסקמא (corr. acc.), Var. קצרתא, v. Tanḥ. ed. Bub. ib.] [ Pl. דּוּרְמַסְקִיּוֹת, v. דַּרְמַסְקִינָא.]
, v. דַּרְמַסְקִינָא
, Pesik. Sos p. 146 a, v. דּוֹרִיָּה
, Esth. R. to I, 1, read דּוֹרוֹנִיּוֹת, v. דִּידְכֵי
, Tosef. Maas. Sh. I, 10 Var., v. דְּרוּסוֹת
, Y. Kidd. I, 58 d, v. דָּרוֹסָה

sense.definition: (דרס) place where hides are trodden or fulled before tanning.
sense.notes: Bets. I, 5 (11 a) you must not place the hide לפני הד' in front of the dor’san (Mish. Nap. a. oth. בית הדריסה, Y. ed. לפני הדריסה).
, v. דַּרְצִינִי

sense.definition: (a perversion of τρωκτή, sub. σταφυλή, v. infra) grape used for dessert, fit for eating but yielding no wine, fig. a woman who has no menstruation.
sense.notes: Nidd. IX, 11. Ib. 64 b; Keth. 10 b (phonetic etymology) דור קטוע [hence the perversion] a cut-off race (bound to die out). Ib. משפחת ד' a family the women of which have neither menstruation nor symptoms of injured virginity. Y. ib. I, 25 a bot. quoting Mish. Nidd. l. c. טְרוֹקְטִי.
, Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 14 Var., v. דּוֹקְרָן

sense.definition: (comp. of דּוּר a. שיני, pl. of שִׁינָּא) [ row of teeth,] gum.
sense.notes: Sabb. 65 a לד' (some ed. לדורשו', incorr.; Ms. M. דורשני, Var. a. Ar. in two words, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) a remedy for the gum. Cmp. דְּרָרָא I.
, v. דַּרְתָּא
דָּשׁ

Sabb. VII, 2 הדָּשׁ he who threshes (on the Sabbath); a. fr.—Euphem. for sexual contact. Nidd. 41 b. Gen. R. s. 85. Pes. 87 b; a. e.—דוש בעקב to trample with one’s heel, to treat lightly, not to heed. Ab. Zar. 18 a. Lev. R. s. 27.

sense.definition: to walk about, be familiar, well-known.
sense.notes: Meg. 24 b אם היה דש בעירו if he has been a familiar figure in his town (so that people do not mind his bodily disfigurement); Y. Taan. IV, beg. 67 b; a. fr.

Ex. R. s. 15 הייתם מְדַיְּישִׁין את העץ וכ' you used to tread upon this piece of wood. Midr. Till. to Ps. VIII, 3 מְדַיֵּישׁ עליך כעפר even one who treads upon thee as upon dust. Gen. R. s. 44 דַּיְּישֵׁם tread upon them.
Targ. Ruth II, 17.—Zeb. 116 b; Men. 22 a, v. דַּשְׁתָּאָה.
Targ. II Kings VII, 17; a. fr.—B. Kam. 9 a דָּיֵישׁ אמצרי he sets his foot upon the landmark (symbol of possession).

sense.definition: to be used to, not to mind.
sense.notes: Sabb. 129 b כיון דדָשוּ ביה רבים since the people are in the habit of doing it. Gitt. 56 b כיון דדש דש being used (to the hammering) the gnat did not heed it. Keth. 62 a דַּשְׁנָן בה we are used to it.—Targ. Prov. VIII, 33 תְדִישׁוּן, v. Af.

sense.definition: to pass over, to leave unheeded, to be listless.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. IV, 15; XIII, 18; XV, 32 Ar. a. Mss. (ed. Lag. אר', מר' with ר, h. text פרע); ib. VIII, 33 (v. supra, ed. Lag. תירשון).—Snh. 7 a (prov.) טוביה לדשמע ואדיש (Ms. M. ואריש) happy he who hears (himself abused) and minds it not; he will escape a hundred evils.—Y. Peah I, 15 c bot.; Y. Kidd. I, 61 b אכול ואֲדֵישׁ … ומַדְשִׁין eat and care not (do not share in our conversation), for so do dogs eat and mind not. [Targ. Y. II Num. XI, 8 אדשין, v. דְּשַׁשׁ.]
Targ. Is. XXIV, 3. Ib. XXV, 10.—[Targ. Jer. XLVIII, 26, v. דְּשַׁשׁ.]
Palp. דַּשְׁדֵּשׁ, v. דְּשַׁשׁ.
, v. דַּוְושָׁא
Sifré Num. 81; Deut. 62 דּוֹשְנָהּ של יריחו (cmp. דֶּשֶׁן Jer. XXXI, 39).

sense.definition: f. (sub. בית) m. a subterranean masoned store-room, cistern, cellar.
sense.notes: [Syr. חדותא grex, horreum, P. Sm. 1200.] [In Mishnah Seder Tohãroth חדות, v. R. S. to Ohol. XI, 8.] B. Bath. IV, 2 he who sells a house, has not sold with it לא את הבור ולא את הר' either the pit or the duth. Ib. 64 a אחד הבור ואחד הד' וכ' bor and duth are subterranean, בור בחפירה ד' בבנין a bor is made by digging, a duth by masonry. Tosef. Erub. XI (VIII), 18; Tosef. Pes. I, 3 היציע והד'; Y. ib. I, 27 b top והחד'. Ib. בח' שיש לה וכ' treating of a ḥ adduth which has a lid. R. Hash. III, 7.—Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 c bot. עולה … לחרות (corr. acc.) when going up with him to the upper story or down to the cellar &c. Kel. V, 6 ed. Derenb. הח'. Ohol. XI, 8 הח'; Tosef. ib. XII, 4 הד'; a. fr.— Pl. דּוּתִיּוֹת. Tosef. B. Bath. III, 1 (Var. דּוּתוֹת, Mish. ib. IV, 2 sing.).—חַדּוּתִין. Y. ib. IV, 14 c bot. חרותין ed. Krot. (corr. acc.). [Our w. seems to be originally חדות, fr. יחד. As to rejection of ח cmp. חַלְבֵּצִין.]
, v. דָּוְותָא
, v. דחי
דַּחֵד (= חדחד) to set apart of each kind. Targ. Y. I Deut. XV, 14 (O. פרש, h. text ענק Hif.) מְדַחֲדָא תְדַחֲדוּן ליה (ed. Amst. מדחר' תדחר', corr. acc.).
, v. דחי
—Denom.:
— Pl. דַּחֲוָן. Dan. VI, 19 (cmp. דַּחְיָיא; oth. opin. = next w.).

sense.definition: (v. preced.) boards used at weddings as tables.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. V, 3 kimḥi (ed. Zuck. רחזינית, Var. רחזוינות).
Targ. Ps. LXII, 9 ed. Lag., v. זְחוֹחָא.
, v. דחי
, v. דִּיחוּי
Koh. R. to II, 2 [read:] דדְחוֹכֵיה מערבבא וכ' he whose feast is disturbed,—what has rejoicing to do with him?; Pesik. Aḥaré p. 169 b הן דרחבה מעורבב (read הָן דדְחוֹכֵיה); Lev. R. s. 20.
Targ. Ex. VI, 6. Targ. Ps. XLIII, 2.
Targ. II Chr. XVIII, 26; I Kings XXII, 27.

Tosef. Yoma IV (III), 14 דְּחָאוֹ ולא מת; Y. ib. VI, 43 a bot. דְּחָייוֹ if the man thrust the goat down the precipice, and it did not die. Snh. 107 b, a. e. תהא שמאל דּוֹחָה וכ' let the left hand repel them and the right invite; a. fr.—Transf. ד' בקש, or בקנה to dismiss with a vague or paltry reply. Ḥull. 27 b. Tanḥ. Ḥuck. 8; Num. R. s. 19; a. fr.
Tosef. Dem. III, 4; Bekh. 31 a; Y. Dem. II, 23 a top, v. חֲבֵירוּת.

Ohol. VII, 6 אין דּוֹחִין נפש מפני וכ' we dare not set aside the regard due to one human life for the sake of saving another human life; Gen R. s. 94 כך עושין דוחים וכ' is it thus one must act? dare you sacrifice one life &c.?—Y. Snh. VIII, 26 c top ד' את הספק to disregard the doubt the benefit of which is to be given to the criminal.—Y. Shek. IV, 47 d bot. דָּחִינוּ אותו וכ' we postponed it (the fast) to the first day of the week; Meg. 5 b דְחִינוּהוּ; Erub. 41 a דְחִינֻהוּ.—Pes. VI, 1 אלו דברים … דוחין וכ' the following performances needed for the Passover offering take precedence of the Sabbath (cause a suspension of the Sabbath laws); a. v. fr.— Part. pass. דָּחוּי a) pushed, hurried. M. Kat. 28 a מיתה דְחוּיָה a hurried death.—b) suspended, superseded. Yoma 7 b, a. fr. טומאה דְּחוּיָה היא וכ' the law about levitical purity is only suspended for the sake of an entire community (and its suspension requires atonement), opp. טומאה הותרה the law &c. is inoperative. Zeb. 12 a ד' מעיקרו unfit from the start, opp. נראה ונדחה, v. infra.—[Yeb. 80 b; Gitt. 57 a דוחה, v. דִּיהַּ.]

sense.definition: to be pushed aside, suspended; to give way.
sense.notes: Meg. 5 b הואיל ונ' יִדָּחֶה the fast being once suspended (on account of the Sabbath), let it remain so (and not be taken up on Sunday). Pes. 66 b איש נ' … ואין צבור נִידָּחִין an individual (if unclean on Passover) is suspended (postpones the celebration) until the second Passover (Num. IX, 10 sq.), but not a community. Yoma 64 a בעלי חיים אינן נידחין animals (dedicated for sacrifices) cannot be removed forever from sacred use (as long as the obstacle lies not in their physical unfitness). Ib. נראה ונ' once fit and then discarded (on account of a temporary unfitness).—Ber. 64 a כל הנ' … שעה נִדֶּחֶת מפניו to him who gives way to time (yielding patiently to circumstances), time will give way, v. דָּחַק.
M. Kat. 22 a מדְחֶה מיטתו he who is anxious to remove the bier of a relative (hurries the burial).

Arakh. 30 b אַדְחֶה אבן אחר וכ' Rashi (ed. אידחה, corrupt. of אֲיַדֶּה; Ar. דְּחֵה imperat. Kal) I will throw a stone after the fallen man (not give the sinner a chance to return). [Naz. 16 b מדחין בה Ar., read with ed. כדהוינן בה.] [Tosef. Toh. VIII, 8 המדחה, v. יָּחַס.]
Targ. O. Num. XXXV, 20 דְּחָהִי he knocked him down (h. text הדף; Y. דַּחְיֵיה). Targ. Ps. CXVIII, 13; a. e.

Zeb. 12 b הוא ד' נפשיה בידים he debarred himself from offering (on account of his apostasy). Pes. 69 b אימא לִידְחֵי I might think they take precedence of the Sabbath. Ber. 23 a גברא דְחוּיָא הוא the person was for the time in an unfit condition to pray (and his prayer does not count at all).
דַּחֵי to push aside, drive off. Pes. 57 a דַּחוּיֵי קא מַדְחֵי לן he sends us off (with a vain promise).
Targ. Ps. XXXVI, 13 אִידָּחֲיַין Ms. (ed. יִדְחֲיַן); a. e.

sense.definition: to be superseded, postponed &c. (v. preced. Nif.).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. IX, 10.—Zeb. 12 b ממילא אי' he was debarred from offering through no fault of his. Ib. גברא אי' the person was unfit; a. fr.
Snh. 45 a (ref. to דוחפו, Mish. ib. VI, 4) מניין שבד' whence do we derive the law that he must be knocked down?; Y. ib. VI, 23 c top מניין שטעון ד'.— Pl. דְּחִיּיוֹת, דְּחִיּוֹת. Ib.

Y. Sabb. XIX, beg. 16 d עיקר דְּחִיָּיתָן וכ' what they chiefly supersede is the Sabbath and that which is required for their execution is labor (otherwise forbidden).—[דְּחִיּוֹת in later Hebr. literature: the reasons for shifting the first day of Tishri in the Jewish calendar.]
— Pl. דַּחְיִין. Lev. R. s. 33, v. דִּיאוֹנִיסִין.—Fem. דַּחְיְיתָא. Lam. R. introd. (R. Joḥan. I) קרתא ד' (translation of קריה עליזה Is. XXII, 2; Targ. חדאה).

Targ. Job XI, 3; Targ. Ps. II, 4, v. דְּהֵיךְ. Targ. Ps. XXII, 8 (ed. Lag. רהב). Targ. Prov. I, 26 (Var. דחף, incorr.).—Pesik. B’shall. p. 93 b דַּחֲכָא וכ' laughing and weeping (Koh. R. to XI, 2 חייכת).

sense.definition: to make sport of, to play.
